text: We lover server Janine she is awesome !!! She makes feel we are at home!! Food is excellent too !!!

I dine here quite often, it's pretty good and fresh, however I wish they had more of a unique variety and less rolls with cream cheese. I also don't like their special sauce, it's sweet, I prefer spicy mayo that most sushi restaurants use. Service is always good, I have not had a bad experience so far.

nice restaurant, all you can eat but it is not a buffet so you have to order.  Foods are good however, the rolls are very big.  only 3 pieces will make you full already.  you can't enjoy much if they make too big.

Went to Blue Fin for AYCE lunch. Really enjoyed the rolls. Fish was fresh and the menu had plenty of rolls to choose from. The Poki salad was pretty good as well as the special roll of the day called a C-4.

Needed to find a new sushi spot and this place happens to be nearby. Glad it is because I was completely satisfied with the overall visit and have been back several times since the first. Fresh, clean flavors. They don't serve Blue Fin Tuna though, at least that's what they told me. Courteous and attentive staff. Lots of dining space to accommodate any size party. My kids enjoyed it also and they'll adjust the menu to take care of finicky tastes buds. Prices are fairly standard sushi prices and they have AYCE, which is all I'll do. It's all or nothing for me! Open late, clean environment, great location. Overall great GV sushi spot.

best sushi place in vegas!
they serve the freshes fishes and the slices of their nigiri's are normal not like those places with small cuts...
they serve fresh wasabi which ive yet to see at other sushi places.
this place is amazing good food, the chef ynot and owner gene are awesome as well!

I have been here 3 times in the past two weeks. That should tell you something ;)
Upon entering you receive a warm welcome from the staff. The service has been great every time I have been here and the food is AMAZING!!! They have a great selection and the "All You Can Eat" is a great deal. I have tried different items at each visit but I have to say the Firecracker Roll and Royal Mexican Rolls are my favorite. If you are looking for great Sushi, great service and a welcoming atmosphere...this is the place to be! Lunch Specials are also a great price.

This place is great! The sushi chefs are all very nice and attentive. Kyle is probably my favorite sushi chef because he's very creative with rolls and will you make you different items based on what you like. It's also very clean, and everyone is very friendly.

I have seen this place many times and I decided to finally visit. After moving here from California I have still yet to find a place as good as some out in cali.

I came here for the AYCE, my first impression was the decor is nice and open not cramped and dark. After getting ignored by the host I finally was able to put my name down. When she called our name she went to seat us... at the bar... I don't mind sitting at the bar sometimes but this time I was on a date and wanted a table normally they ask if you want a table or if the bar is ok however she did not ask me just started sitting me at the bar, I politely asked if we could have a table instead I don't mind waiting a little longer to have a table and she obliged and got me a table within minutes. After sitting us down at the table I had no other interaction with anyone after about 15 minutes I asked a bus boy (you could not tell who were the bus boys or the waiters) if we could get some drinks and he said he will get us some he came back promptly with our drinks and took our first order or sushi for us. We received our first 2 rolls fast and they were delicious but this is where it got even worse.

After we finished our rolls we picked our next, and waited, waited some more, since we didn't have an actual waiter visit our table I had no idea who was a waiter or a bus boy or who our waiter was or anything. After 30 minutes of people walking by over and over and waved one down and asked if I could order some food he said "of course has no one taken your order?" I said no, everyone just walks by and looks at our empty table. He took our order and the chef then bought us our food, well some of our food we didn't receive everything we ordered. After another 30 minutes I waved down the same person and said can I order some more. He gave me another surprised look that no one had taken our order again. Long story short it took 2 hours from being seated to get just a couple rolls. I gave up in the end, I left hungry I did not want to wait any longer for half of what I ordered. It is the most unorganized place I have ever visited. It seemed like no one knew what they were doing, no one had sections to serve everyone was just all over the place. 

Would never come back here, would never recommend it to anyone. They need some major leadership skills.
Incredible service, delicious food and amazing value.  The Sushi was fresh and plentiful!!!!!!

We have been enjoying the Blue Fin for several years now.  The creative group of Sushi Chefs seems to have expanded, and surprisingly, the quality has remained at the consistently high level we have come to expect.  As the economy picks up, so does the number of people that dine there, but that is not a bad thing.  Since we sat at the Sushi Bar, the service was spot-on.  Miso soup is some of the best in the valley, and the sushi is always fresh.  Try the Rock N Roll roll.......

The food was horrible and overpriced. I took my daughter, 4 yr old and 2 yr old grand daughters and they wanted to charge me 14.99 for them to eat. I would not recommend this place. The next day I was really sick not sure if I got food poisoning. I will never go back.
I love this place, the owners are very nice and the food is always great. I would recommend everyone should dine here.

Japanese staff was super friendly, decor was very japanese as well.  They have an option option for all sushi rolls you can eat within an hour, with good selections to please the american palate.  But since I was craving tuna sashimi, I ordered that plus a spicy tuna roll and they were just perfect!  Plus they gave me free hot tea and free orange (beautifully sliced).
Another sushi place. The quality of the fish was ok. Had the poke salad and the tuna they used wasn't all that great. Might have to give it another try maybe..

I've been here a few times. It's good, not the best, but  it's good enough to satisfy your sushi craving. Today I came in for lunch AYCE sushi with my niece who is 10. She got charged the adult price of $21.99. I feel like that is too much. I mean for kids under 7 it's $14.99 and I feel like that's a fairer price for her. I even asked about it before I started ordering but the server didn't respond to me and in the end charged me full. Unfortunately because of that, I probably wouldn't come back here. Sushi places are a dime a dozen and this one isn't that special, it was convenient that's it.

I love coming here for all you can eat. Everything is fresh and delicious. The service is friendly but not overbearing. I love ordering half roles so I can try many things, and I love that more exotic items are included on the AYCE menu. I look forward to my next visit.

For me, this place was just A-OK.  I came on a Saturday for lunch, by myself and sat at the bar.  I was pumped and ready for AYCE sushi.  For me, "sushi" means rolls - I just don't have much interest in the other foods.  For my starter roll I always like to order a spicy tuna - as a judge for my comparison to other places.  To their credit, the Spicy Tuna roll was the largest roll I have ever seen.  I later learned (though it is not listed on the menu) that I could order half-rolls.  Honestly, one roll in and I was starting to feel full - ARGH!  It was a good roll.  

Next, I picked one of their fried roll specials - the Mexican roll.  Now this was new to me.  I've never had a fried roll.  Honestly, it just wasn't very good to me.  I should have stuck to what I know best and not deviated too far.  The roll was larger than the first one and each piece was too large to eat by itself.  Bummer.  I couldn't finish the roll - it was just too much. 

So my AYCE excitement was crashed when I could only finish one roll and a half.  I didn't get to try anything more.  Call me lame for sticking to rolls at a place like this, but it's what I prefer.  

I will add that the place just felt weird to me.  There were about 6 men working behind the counter and the kitchen - and only 3 customers.  Several of the men came out to "catch a glimpse" of another female customer eating by herself.  Kinda creepy.  

I wanted to really like this place, but my experience just didn't do that for me.

Really Great Sushi, and Service is Excellent. 

I read the reviews, and im suprised I have never had a bad experience here. 

I have two favorite local sushi places and this is one of them. 

The fish is fresh and the deserts are great.
It was my 1st time at Blue Fin. Service and food are AMAZING!!!  We're differently coming back for more!  Great job team  (='.'=)
We tried blue fin for lunch one day and we loved everything there the food was great super fresh and fast service . The rolls are giant. So yummy ...

First time here. Super fresh fish and fantastic service!  I had the all you can eat even though I came in for sashimi. I did not regret it. I gave the chef free reign to make what ever he wanted and I was not disappointed.
Was quite pricey but great food. The smell of fish was a bit overwhelming though. My kids were commenting on the smell making the nauseous- maybe it was a bad night

One of the best AYCE restaurants. The nigiri is by far the best in town,cut to perfection and not over-riced also the staff and especially the chefs are really friendly. p.s. they serve there sodas in cans and not from a fountain, uses BiteSquad and has decent appetizers menu.

I really wanted to like this place. We got the AYCE and the first 2 rolls were outstanding. The catepillar and tempura spicy tuna roll were just what I was looking for. It went downhill quickly from there. Every subsequent roll was just plain bad. Maybe I'm just not used to Vegas-style sushi (what is up with all of the wacky/sweet sauces--you're supposed to be able to taste the fish, people!), but I just couldn't deal with the weird combinations. The sweet/fruity/mayonaisey sauces that were on all of the other rolls were just disgusting. They overpowered the flavor of everything, so that all you tasted was the sauce. I eat sushi for the fish, not mayonaise. The cajun albacore? I can't imagine a japanese/sushi restaurant outside of vegas selling that as sushi. It was waaay too strong and there was not that all-important fresh fish flavor that you want from sushi. Everyone working there was super-nice and efficient, I just don't think I'm part of their target demographic. If you like sushi with tons of overpowering wacky sauces, come to this place!
Sushi is so fresh!  Love the choices of the AYCE.  Glad we tried this place and happy to say we've found a new Sushi spot.

Now that Blue Fin offers ALL YOU CAN EAT! I definitely advise that you arrive early.  The Rolls are Great. However, during the time I visited, they had 1 waitress. So because of my All You Can Eat experience, I knew to  order 3 or 4 rolls in the beginning to avoid the long wait.

Did the all you can eat and loved every bite! I had the chefs surprise me with their favorites and they were very fun and made excellent rolls! There are no menu item restrictions which includes appetizers and dessert--unheard of in other restaurants. All the servers were prompt when taking away dishes and refilling drinks. Overall great place, food, and staff!
Finally a sushi place that is affordable, and amazing! Had the spicy spider roll, and golden tiger...so delicious

I love to come here and I am never disappointed. Atmosphere, service, food (delicious) and ambiance are cozy and friendly. I always count down the days for my visit. Thank you blue fin :) I will miss you. Until next time.

We have been there twice. The wait is long and they do not acknowledge the waiting customers. However, that being said, the food quality is excellent. We have visited several ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI restaurants and this is one of the better ones. We tried several different dishes without disappointments. We will go back and hope they work to improve their customer service; other than that we have no complaints. Definitely a recommendation.

They use too much mayo and sauce on everything.   The rolls are huge, too big to fit in mouth.  The tempura tasted weird like cornstarch.  I don't like eating at AYCE places and you get full off of one huge ass roll.  The sides such as the udon and the salmon skin salad should be smaller as well.  

The udon broth and the nigiri was good.  Had the yellowtail and white tuna.   

Overall It was ok, dont think I will be back though.

Tried this place as it was recommended by a friend. My normal is sushi Mon so the bar is set high. Blue fin was ok. I enjoyed the cajun albacore as it was very "cajun" flavor. Other than that, it was just a normal sushi place. The ice cream sucked, red bean and green tea was freezer burned and tasted gross.

We love this place!!! We moved to this side 3 years ago and found this little sushi bar right next door. We have never gone anywhere else since. No where else compares to this!!!!  Great quality fish, awesome selection of rolls, amazing appetizers!!!  We love all of the chefs and they treat us great!!!  We never even have to order.  They already know what we want!!  Well worth your money. Try them out.

Sushi was great, really fast. For some reason the few times I did go it wasn't even crowded. I've been to a whole lot of sushi places, and this one is at the top. You get in and get out. Very quick and delicious. I was hesitant to write a comment because I really like it that it's not over crowded. You get to have a one on one with the chef & the sushi comes flying out, where most places you have to wait like 5-7 min because all the chefs are serving other people. When I go in I like to be served, and that's exactly what I get there, with really great food. Update 10/30/16 I just ate here last week & I noticed that the fish tasted different, so I mentioned it to the chef. He smiled & looked at me & said that this last batch of fish came from Chile because of the price for fish in the US was high. I said that the last time I ate the salmon, it just melted in my mouth. Because of the inconsistency I removed one star. In my opinion I think Sushimon is a little better, but the service is great!

go here a lot with my co-workers and family. good food, reasonable price for AYCE. the staff is friendly and attentive. it's a small place and does get bust around lunch and dinner.

i always leave there ready to burst.

Honestly, this is my favorite sushi place east of the 15 freeway.  I'd like to thank Lisa R. for introducing me to this place, as it is awesome, and very delicious.  It's a smallish sushi bar, and the bar itself only seats about 8 people I think, maybe 10 at a squeeze.  The quality of the fish is top notch, and Chef Jin can make up some crazy combinations for you to try if you let him.  What I really liked is that the pieces of Nigiri style sushi weren't overly large like some places, and he for sure did not over rice on anything, which at an AYCE place is a wonder.  Chef Jin also made this delicious shizo leaf pizza, which was dairy free but totally excellent.  Overall I was extremely happy with this meal and will undoubtedly go back for sushi whenever I find myself craving it and am on the east side.
I loved it, food was great and service was awesome! They were like literally like at attention the whole time and my glass of lemonade was never empty.

The Ayce is the pinnacle of this place the the fish is good the chefs are friendly and the prices aren't horrible either ,deffinitly  a must if your feeling fishy and don't want to spare quality for price.
Nigri was very fresh...  But I agree with other reviewers that the rolls are way over sauced.

Average AYCE sushi place. It's a pretty decent place to dine with friends but the overall food quality ain't good yet ain't that bad either (can't give below average rating for those little appetizers and desserts, can I?) Service was okay except they constantly forget our orders (did you really forget over and over and over?) and we had to flag them down many times to remind them over and over again. Still, they get three stars because it's A-OK despite the fact I don't think this place (like many other AYCE sushi places) is run by real Japanese people.

More like a fusion style sushi.
The dishes look good but used over sauce, covered with other flavor than sushi itself..

Like another Yelper wrote, the quality of fish itself was not great.

Another gem that was close to work. I think what makes this my favorite is because the food is phenomenal, size is great, list of sushi also has seasonal treats, it does get busy but we wait. We see kids there, parties and the bar area is always happy. My advice? Go here and stay away from casinos or resorts that say they have all you can eat and the list is short. This place is a great date place.

My mother and I decided to try lunch here after a gal at CVS told me about it. It's close to where she lives. The staff are very friendly and attentive. My mother had the Sweet Heart roll which she was very happy with. I went for the all you can eat and boy did I eat! I started with the Red Dragon Roll...very good and whatever is in their special house sauce is a perfect combination.  Then I went for their Veggie Royal (?), it's cooked in a tempura batter and has cucumber, avacado, carrots, beets, cream cheese with a eel sauce. OMG, this was the best veggie roll I have ever had and I have tried so many! That roll alone will have me coming back often. I then had Spivey garlic tuna, yellowtail and halibut. We both enjoyed the vanilla tempura ice cream dessert. Yum, large portion that neither of us thought we could possibly finish...but we savored every last bite. Go and enjoy. You will be very glad you did

I wish I could give this half stars because I would give 4 1/2. I got the royal veggie and a cucumber which were both fantastic! Ordering, I thought the royal veggie was a bit pricey ($7.50) but it was a  HUGE roll so I get it now (cucumber was $4). First thing I noticed walking in is that it smelled good and not like rotting fish. I will definitely be back!

Awesome deal for all you can eat sushi and amazing prices on wine!! Selection is ok and flavor is the same. If you're looking for best value though this is the place to be. Customer service is on point as we'll except for when it came to getting the check it was a little slow.

very special... 
the food, the people, the place
fresh fish is very important for sushi and this place have it...
an incredible and extensive menu is supported by the amazing chef's
they also have very good selection of Japanese sake and beer.

We have been eating here for over a year now. Sometimes once a week. Generally it's for lunch but sometimes for dinner. I have never had any sushi here that was less then fresh. 

The service is very attentive and the place is small enough that even when it's busy the service doesn't suffer all that much. The owners are nearly always there cooking and watching over things.

For lunch you can't beat the two roll special for under $9. It comes with choice of two rolls from a list of 14, soup and a wonderful mixed green salad with yummy Japanese dressing. The boxes are around $7 and a lot of food for the money. My wife gets the teriyaki chicken box. There is soup, salad, mac-salad, Cali-roll, rice and plenty of chicken. 

For dinner I get the sushi platter that comes with 7 pieces of sushi, yellowtail, salmon, albacore, Eel, whitefish, choice of cali-roll or spicy tuna, soup and salad all for $13.95.My favorite rolls are the spicy yellowtail and Bluefin special roll. I have only had the all you can eat once about a year ago and it was good too.

The edamame is sometimes a lil over done and the mac-salad often has a bit too much black pepper for us. All in all the value, quality, service and experience are very consistent. We love this place!

Great sushi bar ---  fresh fish, clean flavors, generous portions!

Going to any restaurant in their first month since being open, I always get a little worriesome because there's so many kinks to work out. However, hearing from many friends and coworkers that the sushi was absolutely great, I had to make the trip out. The dining room isn't terribly large - maybe seats about 30 inside but there's a large outdoor "patio" which I could see myself sitting during the cooler months in vegas. However, the sushi bar itself seats about 12 and when I arrived for lunch, being open for only a few weeks, I was surprised but happy to see half the sushi bar was already taken up and few tables dispersed throughout.

 Looking over the menu, prices weren't bad at all with good lunch roll specials. Their hot foods menu was very limited but the roll list more than makes up for it. The chef recommended their "Blue Fin Roll' and it was to die for! We tried a couple other rolls as well as some sushi and their tuna poke salad (yum!).  All the fish was extremely fresh and well cut. Most importantly, the flavors were so clean and well balanced. Something I appreciated the most. Service was ok - it was our waitress's first day of work - so nothing I'd hold them against. The sushi chefs were extremely friendly and quick.

Now here's the thing... in a land of "all-u-can-eat" sushi bar town, they don't do it. But it probably ended up being cheaper than an all-u-can-eat because their rolls are so big that i even had to cancel a couple more I wanted to try knowing there was no way my bf and i could finish them (and we're big eaters to begin with!) and the quality of the fish greatly surpassed most sushi restaurants in town. 

If you appreciated great fish and flavors I highly recommend this place! If you're looking to just fill up and don't care what it tastes like, I'd say you're better off sticking with any all-u-can eat in town.

Yelp sent me here! I came right before lunch ended on a Monday, after the lunch rush. I ordered the blue fin special, white tuna nigiri, rainbow trout nigiri, ahi poke salad, red dragon and mussels. I would skip the mussels, but everything  else was good and tasted fresh. You have to get the white tuna. Its ridiculously melt in your mouth goodness! For $22 lunch AYCE, how could you go wrong?

Another great ayce sushi joint..

Nigiri is fresh and rolls are so good.  Great service - it's a small place so I can imagine it'd be busy on a weekend night.  We went on a weekday so there were only a couple other tables.

Also, get the dessert with strawberries and ice-cream!!

With so many AYCE sushi places in Vegas, the wife introduced me to Blue Fin Sushi, and I think our sushi cravings have found a new home in Vegas.   The fish was of better quality in comparison with other AYCE places.  The pieces fish were chilled (not warm, like in some places we went to) and exquisitely sliced in large portions (some places do a hack job!).  I think the wife and I are purists because we tend to focus on nigiri, instead of the rolls.  This is the main reason why I will come back...the sushi rice.  The sushi rice is amazing here. It has been seasoned so well.  The texture of the short grain rice flavored with the slight hint of sushi vinegar is absolutely perfect for me.  For example, when I take a bite of the super white tuna nigiri, I first taste that slight hum of rice vinegar from the rice on my tongue.  My tastebuds then witness the sweetness and slight creamy flavor of the fish as it slowly intermingles and compliments the vinegar flavor from the rice as I chew.  The wife and I also request that certain sauces should not be poured on the nigiri, such as amaebi.  I just want to taste the rice and the fish, and chew slowly so i enjoy every bit of it. yummm.  The other stand out item to order here is the soft-shell crab appetizer.  This is probably one of the best places that this is prepared.  They use a panko coating/batter and deep fry the think.  It's like eating pork tonkatsu, except instead with a crunchy and crispy crust covering a moist and  tender soft-shell crab.  Definitely, we will be frequenting this place more often.  Plus, I still need to go back to try some Okinawan beer.

Awesome food, very yummy! Highly recommend it. Do the all you can eat. You get a lot of food and choices from the menu. 

There are two locations apparently relatively close to each other but they both are good!!
Always looking for great sushi spots. The only complaint I had was that they sat us in a tight group with 4 other tables when there was plenty of space all throughout the whole place. Fresh sushi!
I love going with friends and family here for the all you can eat. The sushi is very high quality.
They had amazing service and great food! The sushi was absolutely amazing. Our server was so nice and was there constantly to help us. High recommend this sushi bar!!

This place is hands down the BEST AYCE sushi spot in Vegas! 

My boyfriend and i normally get sushi every other week and we usually try to find different spots. I found out about Blue Fin about 2 months ago and OH MY GOOODNESSS! IT IS FREAKING AMAAAZING! This is our favorite spot to go to. The rolls are superb ; always fresh and prepared super fast, and the sauces are very unique. 

The customer service is excellent as wellt! Everyone there makes you feel welcome and the chefs are really nice too.

 It's very spacious and quiet. And yes, they do have TV's, you can ask the chefs if you can change the channel and they wouldn't mind at all. Everyone here, is always nice and they really make you feel welcome.  

If you're hesitant about trying Blue Fin out, don't! Just try it out and you won't regret it :) Don't let the outside fool you either, it doesn't look appealing from the outside, but trust me, it is thebomb.com :P

Ohh, and make sure to try the Gangnam Style & Golden Tiger; YUMMMMM!

Terrible service.. We did the all you can eat special after we each ordered 2 rolls they never came back to ask if we wanted more. We paid $21 each for all you can eat but only got 2 rolls that was only $17 each.  Sushi is mediocre at best. Will not go back. Highly disapointed.

My husband and I have tried many sushi places here in Vegas and we finally found the one we love!!! Blue fin has been the best sushi place because of their amazing service, we always get our refills quickly without asking, the staff is really nice and helpful as well as welcoming.The nigiri is by far the best we've have ever had, it is so fresh and portioned out great. The many rolls they have are very flavorful and fresh.Each roll has its own unique flavor and it's amazing.The appetizers are so good especially the gyoza, baked mussels and baked scallops.And the desert is to die for, the tempura icecream is the best ever.I strongly recommend this place to anyone, my husband and I love it and are there at least 2-3 times a month and every time had been stunning.

I am quickly becoming a regular at Blue Fin. The fish is always fresh, the service fast and the restaurant clean. 

My favorite thing about this restaurant is their Happy Hour. It's from 5-11, 7 nights a week. The only problem is, you have to make sure and ask for the happy hour menu. For some reason, it's not something they readily hand out. The happy hour menu isn't the full menu, but they still have some good deal to compliment their specialty rolls. The crunch roll from the happy hour menu is one of the best I've had!

I highly recommend Blue Fin to anyone looking for fresh sushi, good prices and a nice environment!

I am not a big sushi fan but my boyfriend absolutely loves this place. I love that you can get all you can eat at a reasonable price  and it includes appetizers and desserts. The quality seems good and service is fast....

I've driving been driving by this location about a thousand times debating whether to give it a try. Last week I decided to take the plunge. It's much much smaller inside than it looks from the outside. Don't bring kids!  I tried the AYCE which was $26.95. They wanted to charge me $26.95 for my 2year old which doesn't know how to eat sushi and won't allow outside food. 

The food was ok,  Nothing special. The rice was dry and the flavor of the rolls were weird. I definitely won't be coming back due to the service and charging full price for kids that can't and won't be eating.
I just ordered a sashimi combo to go and it was probably one of the freshest sashimi I have ever had in Las Vegas. Blue Fin Sushi is now on the top of my list.

Best sushi I've ever had! The rolls are not loaded down with rice so the rice to fish ratio is perfect. The fish is super fresh, the servers are amazing, and the chefs are super nice. One chef made sure I liked everything and even made me a special roll that's wasn't on the menu. My favorite roll was the Blue Fin Special- it was to die for!!!!! I can't believe how much I love this place. If you are a fan of baked green mussels, they have a very unique approach to the dish while keeping it simple. Also, they allow half rolls of everything except deep fried rolls so that's great especially if you want to try everything. I will definitely be back to this place. I'm already counting down the days.....
Second favorite local sushi bar. Always delicious. AYCE is typical pricing. A little higher than Sushi Bay. More seating. Larger seating area than before. Friendly staff.

Simply amazing! The food was fresh the service was on point! The price for the AYCE was only $21.99 during lunch and it was worth every penny of it and then some. Enjoyed great food with great company! I will definitely be going there in the very near future thank you for the experience!!!

So disappointed. Went because there were 4.5 stars.  Never again.  Ordered the all you can eat.  Our first roll the Spider roll, understanding it is soft crab shell and it tends to be a bit hard to chew.  It was so hard when I bit into it, it hurt my teeth and I could not chew it, as it was so hard.  next roll was a cucumber roll, simple, but again, the seaweed was chewy and i could not bite through it with my teeth.  Can not remember what the 4th 1/2 roll was, because it was not any better.  So, with all you can eat, it means just that.  I ordered another roll (twice I asked for it) yet it never came.  Nor did my Miso soup, edamame, after asking for a 3rd time; we were done.  Asked for our bill and told them NOT to charge us for the all you can eat- duh- but was charged additional for a 1/2 roll, apparently cutting a roll in half creates work that must be charged for.  Overall, bad experience, bad food and will never go back.

Out of all sushi places here in Las Vegas this is by far the best AYCE sushi. **HANDS DOWN** my family and I have been eating here for almost 8 years not only they have the best sushi they also have the best customer service here. I would recommend anyone to eat here. You won't be disappointed. TRUST ME!

If I could give zero stars I would. We ate here on a recent trip to LV due to a recommendation from a local. This was the worst sushi I've ever had in my life. There was so much rice it was absurd. It was packed on so thick, not a single piece was bite sized. Everything comes out drowned in sauce and includes crab salad. I don't understand any of the good reviews people are leaving, makes me sad for them that they think what is being served here is good sushi. I've had better sushi from the grocery store. Don't waste your money here.

This place was really good! I loved all the food, but the service was a little slow and not too attentive but it was still an overall great experience. I'll definitely be coming back again. 

My favorite thing eating was the R.M Spicy Roll, yum! And the tempura ice cream wasn't anything too special. I wouldn't recommend the green tea flavor of ice cream. It had a weird florally taste. 

I'll definitely still be coming back (:

Always looking for the best sushi place in town with a good balance between quality and price. I mean sure you can to social house and drop a $ 100 or more per person, but is the food 5 times better than blue fin? I think not, quality of fish, presentation, the personal service can't be beat. Tell them what you want and they'll make it happen. They took my salmon, tuna, avocado, and yum yum hand roll to new levels. After all the places blue fin is still top. Give'em a try, hope this review helps.

Let me just begin with the service: It was amaaaaaaazing and sooooo engaging. NOT. It was lackluster at best. Everyone from the busser to the waitress to the sushi chef rarely smiled and did not engage us unless it was necessary. And by necessary this means coming back every 30 seconds to ask if I was ready to order (as I was clearly still reading the extensive menu). None of them wanted to be there. I don't know if something had happened there earlier, but everyone had a somber face. I actually missed work while I was at lunch because everyone at my office is happy! We had empty glasses of water and dishes sitting at our table for about 15 minutes before they realized they should probably come over and provide whatever service they provide. 

Blue Fin Special( In: Cajun Albacore, Cucumber / Out: Tuna, Salmon, yellowtail, shrimp and avocado with Chef special sauce) --- I am SOOO glad I only ordered a half roll because this was just not edible. It was the mushiest thing I've ever had the displeasure of eating.. loaded with sauces that mask the natural flavor of the fish.. I only had one piece out of the 4 because I wasn't about to force myself to eat this despite the all you can eat policy where they charge you menu price for anything you don't finish. 

Johnny Johnny Roll (In: Mild Spicy Soft Shell Crab / Out: Spicy Tuna, Avocado with Yum Yum and Spicy Ponzu Sauce) --- This wasn't as saucy/mushy as the Blue fin roll, but it was equally as terrible. I ate two out of the four pieces.. There was just nothing special about these "special rolls." The fish didn't taste fresh and the sauce was just overpowering. 

Spicy salmon hand roll & salmon skin hand rolls: These were good. They're very basic rolls though, so they're hard to mess up. I actually had these before anything else, so I was very excited to what was to come.. only to be disappointed!

Baked green mussels --- this is served in an escargot dish.. They really skimp on the mussels.. instead of getting a whole mussel per spot, they cut them in half.. so you're eating a tiny bite that might as well be considered nonexistent considering the amount of cheese they cover this dish with. You seriously might as well ask for melted cheese, because this is what it was. I was highly disappointed by this dish, as baked green mussels are one of my all time favorite things!

Scallops --- omg. this was fried to shit. It almost tasted like they reused oil to fry this.. couldn't even taste the scallops! 

Chicken katsu curry --- this was fairly tasteless.. the chicken was bland and overdone. This solely served the purpose of getting rid of my hunger -- It was uneventful and forgetful. Boooooring.

I was more than happy to pay the a la carte price for all the sushi I did not finish because it was so sub-par. However, they were gracious enough to not financially or digestively punish me in this situation. They simply removed it and hopefully gave it a proper burial.

HOWEVER, the highlight in this discovery is that this would be a great restaurant to take your companion if you wanted to break up. It's private, everyone's in a bad mood already, and the parking is close.

Bar far my favorite sushi spot in Vegas! Love the ambiance and the food is amazing. It's located on Sunset one block maybe two west of Green Valley. We of course had the AYCE and may have overdone it cause it was so delish. We all left with our stomachs hurting cause we ate so much but not a shocker I often get too excited when going out for sushi.

The Yum Yum roll was my favorite! The mussels are good but do not come in a shell they are served  on a fancy dish.

They recently expanded to double its size so that should tell you something.

I am always skeptical about trying new sushi places because of bad experiences in the past but I am so glad that I chose to try out Bluefin. I was greeted the moment I walked in, I was seated, I ordered and received my sushi very quickly. The sushi chefs were extremely nice and the sushi was delicious. I will definitely be going back.

Great value! 

The all you can eat is everything on the menu, not just rolls. 

The sushi was above average quality on both taste and presentation. 

The service was timely, and the staff was friendly. 

Next trip to Vegas, this place is on my list of places to eat again for sure.

Eat here only if you want to be rushed and hurried through your meal. The second you sit down and they are on you wanting to know what you want to drink and what rolls you want. The glasses they brought over for our beers were dirty on top of that. The rolls were laced with tons of sauce, overstuffed with imitation crab, and the one that was the worst was the spicy tuna roll, that was dripping with oil. They kept bringing over the WRONG rolls too?! We asked for the check and the waiter told us we have to eat more of our last roll first.....which was our plan anyway, we just wanted the check to get out of there, we didn't need to be reminded to eat our food like we were five years old. This place should be called SUSHI GONE WRONG, and I am mad at myself for spending my money there.

This is one of the best sushi places I have been in a long time. I paid for the all you can eat and OMG was amazing to try everything. It was different then most sushi place were paying for a normal small roll which here I receive more then needed. 

I shall be coming here again.

This place was amazing. Never have I been to an All You Can Eat Sushi spot where everything is made fresh to order! The rolls were creative and good, the ahi poke salad was delicious, and the jalapeño creations were tasty. The service was good and that always makes your meal taste a whole lot better. They have screens if you're wanting to watch a game which is a plus.

Favorite AYCE sushi! We always sit at the sushi bar and the chefs really take care of us. The price of AYCE is about the same as almost every other AYCE sushi place in town. Appetizers and dessert is included in the price which is always a plus.

We ate couple of nights and it was bad... reaaallly bad.

What happened? It was so bad we left early. Even the nigiris are bad. We only had 2 special rolls but it was bad as well.

Fish was old, rice was old. 

We wont come back, quality of food bad. With the price for the AYCE should be great food
I love them! All their rolls are extremely fresh and tasty. I order from them often and have never had any complaints. They're all delicious!

Went to Blue Fin Sushi last night.....  We decided to go alacart.  I ordered a Tuna Poke salad.  When I got it I noticed it had way to much jalapeño in it so I quietly picked it out as I choked down the ridiculously spicy seaweed and tuna concoction.  By the time I finished the small bowl I had removed almost a full jalapeno!  (I was starving or I would have complained).  My lady ordered a mixed fish roll that clearly didn't have what it supposed to on the inside ($13 roll) but she was also starving so nothing was said.  We were both still hungry so we ordered a Kari roll (pretty sure I spelled it right)  on the menu it said it had soft shell crab in the center (and only soft shell crab)  We got the roll and dug in.  First bite I noticed it tasted like mayo (overwhelmingly ... also a $13 roll) and I looked at it.... sure as shit it was full of crab stick!  We ate the fish off the top and left the rest.  Our waiter came by and saw this and asked if everything was okay....  I proceeded to tell her the roll didn't match the description on the menu.  She then spouted off and said "we always mix in crab stick in all our soft shell crab."  Which i replied that it should say that on the menu like it does with all the other rolls.  I told her I didn't enjoy my poke salad either because it was overwhelmingly hot.  She kept looking at my lady like I was crazy then brought us our check....  no manager came to apologize or anything... $45 later we left upset and discouraged.  There are too many delicious sushi places in Vegas to waste your time and money on this place.

Always Awesome!
The place: small, quiet, clean, 
The staff: friendly, efficient, quick
The food: delicious ficious!

More about the simple nigiri sushi and basic rolls - but done really well.
There are fancy, American-style rolls and treats here as well. 
They have no problem with requests and special orders.

My fave in this part of town.

This is a good AYCE place but their roll selection isn't that versatile. Don't get me wrong, it's very yummy, but I like seeing creative combinations!

What I really appreciate about them: 
-You can do 1/2 orders of some rolls, just ask
-Dessert is included in AYCE - NO LIMIT ON MOCHI, weeee!
-Good for groups
-They have TVs, which my husband appreciates when a big game is on!

It's definitely a good neighborhood place to go to when we're looking for good AYCE.
Great place for the price! Never crowded! Great rolls! Give it a try

yes!!! Finally a delicious sushi place. O....M....G!!! Not only was it delicious but our server Omar was very helpful and made very good suggestion. Everything we tried was just perfect. I will BE BACK!!! Can't wait!!! Highly recommend you will not be disappointed.

Soooooo good. In about 10 visits I haven't found a single thing to complain about. The service is great, chefs friendly, and the food tastes amazing. Highly recommend Blue Fin if you are looking for sushi.
This place is the best. For real. Fish is always so fresh, their rolls are inventive and the staff is super warm and friendly. Definitely a go-to for sushi - never disappoints!

There's an AYCE option for like $24/$28 depending on lunch or dinner. The regular menu prices if you don't want to stuff your face with AYCE sushi is pretty reasonable. It's like $8 a plate! The quality of the food is really good. The screaming orgasm appetizer was amazing, though I admit I just ordered it for the name. You should try it!

The employees are kind, they don't linger too much which I like. It's a small place but very cozy. It's a little way out of the strip, but eating in those expensive sushi restaurants there before, the quality of the sushi is pretty much the same (arguably better). 

Definitely will be coming back here again!

I am in awe of the service here. 5 stars allllll the way around here! The food was fresh, delicious,and fast! I am really over the moon about this place! The fish was super fresh and everything was just so tasty! The calamari wasn't your ordinary calamari, it was cut up pieces of steak! Sooo delicious!  Ok back to the service. The service was AMAZING!  Took the time out explain, suggest and even altered a roll because of the cream cheese. Such a great place to dine with friends or as a date night. Not too loud actually perfect! Come and enjoy super fresh sushi at an ultimate gem of an ayce!

First time was great. Second time with my wife and daughter not so good. I ordered the blue fin lasagna. We order a bunch of other food and it all came in, to include mochi dessert. They kept telling me it (blue fin lasagna) should be almost done or that it would be 15 minutes to bake. After about 30-40 minutes later, they said it was burned and asked if we wanted something else (as if to say they were sorry). We wanted to get the tempura ice cream anyway. So we ordered it. Final bill came in and they charged the tempura ice cream. Other restaurants would likely have done that at their expense to redeem themselves from the food burning. Not Blue Fin.  The sushi my wife ordered tasted like Oahu 7-Eleven Sushi for $10-13. You're better off getting the Sushi from Smith's right down the road for $7.99 on Sunset. There's a better sushi (Island Sushi Grill) place on Eastern with great locals from Hawaii. They treat you like ohana and have yet to burn an order.

I am giving 4 stars for the service and the pricing of the all you can eat. The food is more like 3 stars. The fish is fresh but they use too much sauce. I don't like my rolls swimming in thick sauces, i want to taste the fish!

I hate to give this place only 3 stars because the staff was so nice, but the nigiri is average at best. As a hardcore sushi fan, I only order nigiri and sashimi when I eat out so this review is not for their rolls if you're a roll lover. Point to note: this restaurant does not have sashimi on their AYCE menu, but I've never been to such a place that insanely does that.

I ordered the following nigiri: salmon, mackerel, red snapper, unagi, albacore, and amebi (sweet shrimp). The unagi was delicious, but the rest were mediocre. The amebi should be called "a-mini" at this place because it was the perfect representation of Japanese related entities as depicted on Family Guy-- indeed it was "tiny everyting." The sushi rice was unseasoned and dry, but was edible because I had waited until 3 p.m. to eat lunch. I also ordered a seaweed salad, which was not bad and tasted like all the seaweed salads I've ever tasted. 

Like I said, the staff was nice, but even at 3 p.m. when not many customers occupied the restaurant, service was slow. I appreciate the sushi chef though because he kept motioning the 5 or so servers to speed up. 

Overall, if you live in the Henderson area and are starving, this place is a great alternative to Goyemon, my favorite AYCE sushi place. But as someone who has had the best meal of her life at Shibuya at the MGM, Blue Fin is one step above super market sushi at best!

After going on a hunt to find other great sushi spots within the Henderson area, this place is definitely the cream of the crop. Their specialty sushi rolls are deep fried/baked, and absolutely delicious! Fans of modern sushi/sushi with a twist will love it here. The sushi is more "savory" than sweet (the rolls were mostly combinations of the fish meat with other "heavier" type things like cream cheese, etc, and hardly any combinations of fish with fruit). I personally have to be in the mood for deep fried sushi, but when I am - this is the spot! Also, they have azuki bean (red bean) ice cream! So make sure you save room in your dessert stomach for something sweet.  Next time I go back, I'm looking forward to try one of their dinner specials.
Love this sushi place! I eat here honestly about once a week and the fish is always fresh. Super nice owners too, and the service is amazing! No complaints!

My new favorite spot in Vegas!! The all you can eat prices are awesome! The sushi was fresh and delicious!!! The service was pretty good... not the best but far from an issue. All in all a great spot and I will be returning... constantly!!!

This was a real suprise negative experience because Yelpers are pretty happy with this place. The sushi was all sauces and toppings masking poor quality fish. The girlfriend didn't finish any of it which is rare. I ordered the katsu curry. Tasteless and bland while overcooked. The service was poor and e everyone was in a bad mood or generally unhappy people. Had to ask for water again and again. Was a bad experience and I won't be back for awhile. Never say never so ill assume they will get better or they won't last.

I have been coming here for a few years. Usually every month or two. it's my go to Sushi Spot. AYCE is a good value considering how fresh everything tastes. I usually don't mess with rolls and strictly order off the nigiri menu. I don't know the staff by name but they recognize me so sometimes hook me up with limited edition pieces they get on occassion. Recently entertained some clients here for lunch. They had a new server I hadn't seen before but she was very nice and more personality that the girl that I have usually seen in the past.

Mmmmmm.
Toyko roll.
Edamame.
Squid karage kushi.
Many many many more rolls throughout the night.

Only thing i don't like is that they sell soda by the can...i personally think fountain soda drinks taste better but i can overlook that!

Mmmmm.

We come here quite often every single time food is excellent, very busy yet well staffed and service is great. We even have a signature hand roll that Kevin has perfected and  surprisingly remembers it..

Based on all the good reviews, my best friend and I thought maybe we came on an off night. It was our first experience here and we weren't impressed. The service was outstanding, but the food was not up to par. It was almost as if the fish wasn't fresh. We have been to quite a few different places so we know what to expect in our sushi. Everything we tried was medicore. We probably wont be returning to Blue Fin.

Came here for the last minute UYE. This was actually my first UYE and I had a great time. I ordered probably everything off the nigiri menu and it was excellent. The rolls were pretty good too, but i'm a nigiri/sashimi guy, and they were standout. They also have something called a mexican roll, and it was actually made from a tortilla shell, which was quite clever. The special that the sushi chef made were raw oysters with tobiko and another fish egg, and lychee sorbet! It was so good. Had a great time.
Had the AYCE and no where near as good as Sushi Koma on the west side or Sushi Twister on Boulder . Will not be coming back here.

So...I'm in Vegas visiting my friend and we wanted some sushi..so I looked up some stuff on Yelp and found this place. We had good service, good beer and overall we enjoyed everything. The main problem I have with this place is that they use imitation crab in every roll except the soft shell crab rolls. ( I don't like soft shell crab so I guess I'm SOL) My friend didn't mind at all because she said that she can't tell the difference. I CAN tell the difference! I just don't get it!! Don't say it's crab if it's not crab!! WTF! You don't put fake tuna in your roll...so why put fake crab?? Anyway I do have to say although the crab was fake the rolls were still very good. I really liked the Wet Dream. We both agreed that it was our favorite. Overall the service was good, the rolls were pretty and good and the beers...also good.

This place is easily one of the best AYCE places I've had. I think it's even  better than Goyemon in my opinion. 

All the rolls I've tried are full of flavor and each roll that I've had has had a different unique flavor. I like getting the blue fin special and the super white tiger. The fish is fresh and the rolls aren't doused in eel sauce, which makes me a happy camper. 

The rolls are big so beware and dont over order. Blue fin is now in my rotation of sushi restaurants when I crave sushi. 

All rolls come out in a timely manner, and they aren't over wrapped with rice. I think you definitely get quality fish here for AYCE.

First time here.  Food was decent,  but the service was awful.  We were not greeted at the door with someone behind the counter.  The waiter was slow and not friendly. Get some cheerful personalities and we would return .

My favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. Period. Every time my wife and I try another sushi spot, we always tend to compare it to this place. Been coming here a couple years now, and never disappointed.

they gave me food poisoning  last night 2/12/16..  don't eat their!!! The worst place ever... what a shit hole.. it's very obvious to me that the owners have no respect for their clients or they wouldn't serve such shity slop..

The more AYCE sushi I have in Vegas, the more I appreciate a la carte places: they typically have the quality I want, without the obligation to overeat to "get my money's worth". I'd be in trouble if I lived closer to Blue Fin, because it's a good combination of the best of both worlds!

Came in on a random weekday evening, sampled a bunch of their apps (the poke was a bit spicy, the screaming o was mostly sauce, and the tempura soft shell crab was a flavorless half crab), lots of nigiri (the garlic tuna and spicy garlic tuna were both standouts!) and a few of their rolls (the featured special roll, CM4? was the best). 

Fish was fresh, rolls were tight, rice was correctly portioned, and even better than all of the above was the service. Like I said, I tend to overdo it at AYCE joints, but the servers here were super-fast and nonjudgmental- every time more food was brought out, they'd ask without batting an eye what we'd like next.

I've been coming here for a while now and never had a bad experience until today. I ordered 3 orders of spicy garlic tuna and not once was it brought to us. So the 3rd time waitress very nice asked if I got everything. I told her no 3 times I've yet to get my order. Then my sister orders baked mussels. She pulled one out with legs. Looked like a baby crab. When we asked the waiter what it was just made a joke and avoided the question 2 times. These last 3 visits have been bad,  but this one takes the prize. I let the waiter know that I was drinking lemonade he poured me water 3 times. Probably won't be back for 25.99 dinner and I have to have a bad experience every time I'll save my money.
Love this place. Always fresh & delicious. Been here several times & never disappoints. They do great @ accommodating large groups too,
Food was good but only issue I found was the tables being too close to the wall which made eating very uncomfortable.
Great food and great service. And real Asians making your sushi. Most of our sushi in Vegas are no longer made by Asians. The Latin peeps are taking that over also.

Great sushi and service, off the beaten path.  Everything is fresh, well prepared, and delivered to your table in record time. Don't be scared off by the all the you can eat pricing.  Blue Fin is not like any of the other all you can eat sushi joints.  It is a great value.

Ate here once with the wifey. Typical all you can eat sushi place. You order from a menu and staff brings out your food. They seem to be faster at getting your food out compared to say island sushi. The food taste great and the prices are really reasonable. Can't do much better imho. Will definitely come back.

Good place if you like deep fried sushi. All of the rolls besides nigri are deep fried or have some component of deep fried food in them.

No basic baked rolls.

Pushy service to the point it was overwhelming.

Nice interior.

Truly excellent sushi! I discovered that they do and all you can eat in the afternoons with a few ground rules. You have to eat everything on the dish did you order before you order another dish (like something your mom would tell you) :), any only get like an hour and a half. But seriously, do you really want to continue to eat any food for longer than an hour and a half?
The fish was definitely top shelf. The sauces and glazes where use conservatively and effectively. I've been back twice and have had a consistently great experience. Try their signature rolls or their signature apps, you won't be disappointed.

So what if I'm a little late in writing reviews?  Granted that I moved away from Henderson in June of 2012 and have been eating there from 2009 until I left, but better late than never I suppose...

Where to start?  I lived at the apartments by that intersection and EVERY SINGLE DAY after school I had to make a decision. Make a left to go home or make a right to Blue Fin.  Let me tell you, 8 times out of 10, Blue Fin won.

Their lunch special portions are great for the price.  I usually get the 2-roll lunch special and end up not having dinner.  In the event that I go for AYCE (which is quite often), I LOVE their ikura (I think it's the best in Vegas) and that one roll with the guacamole (I KNOW, right? Don't judge until you try it) is amazing.  It may not be the most traditional sushi joint ever (especially since I have been spoiled by Little Tokyo in LA), but it's sushi with a little 'fun' mixed into it (without being too far out).

The staff has always been awesome and very attentive. I've never had a problem there. Once and a while I'll take my notes with me to study while I sit and eat yummy sushi in the patio area. Also, whenever my family comes to visit me from California, I always take them to Blue Fin.

So sad that I moved to Oregon...I've been missing Blue Fin since.

I would say it tasted like store bought sushi, but I would never insult Whole Foods like that. 

We tried Blue Fin because it was closer to my neighborhood than my go-to spot. The reviews on Yelp (thanks guys -_-) seemed great, so we decided to try it. How can I put this...Blue Fin is like that pathetic ex boyfriend that you refuse to waste your unlimited text messages on.

At the start of our meal, we were greeted by a smile-less "have you been helped already?" Now keep in mind this is a sit down sushi restaurant, not a fast food establishment. Shortly after sunshine took our orders, the appetizers arrived. It must've been fate or something because I've always wanted to try really chewy calamari! The kind where you take one bight, and the whole thing comes out of the skin because it was cooked so well! How did they know?!! 

Then we received our rolls. Are you people effing kidding me? Yes, the rolls are big, but I prefer quality over quantity. They are made with too much overcooked rice and last week's catch of the day. So gross. So once our first roll came out, we decided  to be brave and try other things off the menu since we ordered the all you can eat. Where was our server? In the corner, staring blankly at the t.v above our table. I was staring at her, said excuse me, sent a pigeon, and shot a flare gun trying to get her attention...NOPE. 

Our busser was great! He took our drink orders, cleared our dishes, took the majority of our food orders and wait...where was our waitress?? Standing in the corner of the 10x10 box, (in which they call a restaurant) staring at the t.v and checking her phone. You could tell it was the type of place where they shared tips, otherwise I would've would've only gave 10%. I really hope he got my tip because she didn't deserve it.

At the end of our meal, she just drops off the check. No smile, no "thank you" nothing. So that's when I asked "were you our server?" She said "yes". To which I replied "really? Cause the busser took most of our orders while you were just standing in the corner watching tv." "Then she said  "the bussers are supposed to do that, whoever is closer. I did not watch tv at all." "Do you feel like you did a good job? Cause I did not." Her response was "I'm sorry you feel that way." Thank you for your backwards apology sweetie. I really appreciated it. I'm sorry too. I'm sorry that not only was the food disgusting, so was your attitude. 

To put it simply, our server's name was Jin. If she's not your server, I'm pretty sure you'll have a tolerable experience. If she is, hold up your cross and run away!!
The service and atmosphere were great, and the sushi was some of the best I've had! Highly recommend this place to anyone from, visiting, or passing through Henderson.

This place is a must visit if you enjoy sushi. The special roles that they make will knock your socks off. Sashimi was as fresh as any I have ever had. The owners are very personable and service was outstanding. If I could give this more stars I would.

I thought the place was pretty great. My first time going to a sushi restaurant with a group of people who love sushi. I got a lunch special with a choice of two rolls and it came with soup and salad. It was all very tasty, I really enjoyed it. I would, and probably will return in the future. We shared entrees and there were other dishes that were even better tasting than mine. Very yummy. The inside of the restaurant was clean and modern; great environment.

Amazing sushi!
Sat at the bar and he custom made rolls
For me based on what I love.  So fresh & delish!  It's right by my house. I go all the time.

Great service! Food came out super fast! Every roll was consistently delicious 
The salmon was also really good and the super white tuna a couple of my favorites! 
Ultimate blue fun roll  wet dream  must
 try and the Royal shrimp ENJOY GREAT PLACE FOR AYCE!!!
Great place and our go to for sushi.  Food is always good and fresh and the owner, Jin, takes a personal interest in the service his guests receive.  Kudos!

I am sad to write this review. A friend took us to the lunch special a year or so ago. I was disappointed when eating with my party of 7 for the ayce. Service was excellent as far as wait staff and friendliness. But sushi was subpar. The nigiri was thin and rice would not even stay on it to pick it up. The rolls were similar. I found the menu lacking in creativity and quality was just not there in comparison to other sushi places.

Fun and interesting rolls beyond the usual California or Philadelphia, but they have those too if you want it. Standout item has to be the Spicy Garlic Tuna nigiri. Be sure to try the iced green tea too. Great wait staff and a nice quiet atmosphere you don't typically get at AYCE sushi spots.
Fair price for all you can eat sushi.  The food was good and the service was attentive.  Their Strawberry Nigori Sake is a MUST HAVE!  I've NEVER had sake so good!

I took my wife to Blue Fin for a late lunch on Valentine's Day. Hostess was courteous and knowledgeable. We enjoyed the spacious seating, which is fairly hard to come by in a sushi establishment. Will come back with the kids, as many families were dining there with young children. Our server was very attentive and we were able to customize our sushi orders, i.e. half orders, add crunch etc. Appetizers were delicious albeit lacking a bit in variety. $21.99 for lunch is a great value!! We will definitely be returning!!

Great food and great service. 
The Sushi is delicious!!!
The service and the quality of ingredients is outstanding.

Place is small, you can sit outside... In this heat, no thanks.

Service was BAD. We had to ask multiple times for things. My fiance had plastic,

YES PLASTIC in his water.

Food, is mehh. We've had better.

My 5 month old daughter was with us, and her outfit had gotten messy while we were there, so I took her in the bathroom, and changed her, without making a scene. However, I had a mommy brain fart, and forgot to pack a second outfit.

It was a week day, and the place was NOT busy. So, because I knew that we were just waiting for dessert and the check, I walked out with her in a blanket and her diaper. 

The waitress just had to ask why my baby was "naked." Making it seem like I was an unfit parent. Almost drawing attention to our table. Making us very uncomfortable.

We couldn't get out of there fast enough.

Originally I ate here because it was close to where I live and I just wanted some late night sushi but this place has quickly turned into one of my favorites which is rare since I can be a picky sushi eater. My favorite all time rolls here are the Wet Dream and Royal shrimp which I will probably get every time I go here. I sat at a normal 2 person table and service was fast and steady as far as I can remember. Only thing I can think of to improve would be to not have to wait so long in between rolls
My friend had the grilled teriyaki beef last Friday night. He immediately threw up and was sick all weekend

We go here once a week. Seriously. Once a week! Both the chef and I enjoy the varity of rolls and our service has always been spectacular. Here are a few of our favorite rolls:


Johnny Johnny: (Brein's favorite)!
In: Mild Spicy Soft Shell Crab / Out: Spicy Tuna, Avocado with Yum Yum and Garlic Ponzu Sauce
 
White Tiger: In: tuna, Crab Meat / Out: White Tuna, Avocado with yum yum Sauce
 
Over the Rainbow: Diced tuna, yellowtail, super white tuna and salmon with chef special sauce inside and
 
Screaming Orgasam: (Order the sauce on the side, otherwise it is drenched and not good!) Seared Tuna, Radish Sprout, Daikon Noodle, Sesame Seeds and Chef Special Sauce
 
Cucumber Salad: Cucumber, Imitation Crab Meat with Sweet Vinegar Dressing
 
Crazy Yum Yum
 
Blue Fin Special: In: Cajun Albacore, Cucumber / Out: Tuna, Salmon, yellowtail, shrimp and avocado with Chef special sauce
 
Marrissa: In: Shrimp Tempura, Cucumber, Avocado, Masago / Out: Fresh Tuna, Garlic Chip with Special Sauce

I love sushi!! It was my first time at this Sushi Restaurant. Food was OK. Nothing really stood out but I have to admit their portions for AYCE was pretty generous and the price was decent for the overall experience.

This is probably my least favorite ayce sushi joint. Service wasn't the best. They apparently ran out of certain items and failed to notify the table until when I asked again before I got the check. Probably will never go back.

Not bad. Ambience was just too quiet and bright. Night wasn't busy, was seated in back room by sushi bar. 2 servers and a bus boy. No one could refill our waters. I'm a server myself and I just felt our server didn't enjoy her job.  Food was decent, not the best. Rolls were overly sauced up, and rice kept falling apart from nigiri.

A LOT of my yelp peers hold Blue Fin very VERY highly and i've only been here once but i feel that the service was just a bit off the night we went. 

We put in a few orders of salmon skin hand rolls and they didnt come out till the end of our meal so that was a bit weird. And other little mix-ups like orders coming in that belonged to the other side of the table. 

Ordered and tasted way too many different types of rolls to make any kind of useful list. But of the various things we did order it's very noticeable that the fish is fresh and the spicy tuna and yellow tails have just the right amount of spicy bite that makes it enjoyable but not holy crap holy crap holy crap kill me now my insides are on fire. 

Overall i'd love to come back with a considerably smaller group but alas i live on the opposite side of town...
This place is always good for all you can eat sushi.  I get it for lunch when I am at the office and for dinner when the kids feel like sushi.  Their garlic tuna is amazing!

I've read the reviews for this place and had high expectations. Had being the key word. Me and the wife had the AYCE, and we chose this place based off of the good reviews from other yelpers. Overall I believe this place is lacking.... In everything. We checked out the menu and majority of it had crab meat, imitation at that. Limited menu compared to other sushi places. Only certain rolls you could get at half rolls where other places like Kaizen you can get their whole menu in half rolls. Service was adequate for us, but there were two guys sitting at the bar and the two servers (male and female) were making fun of them because of what they were wearing, and the male server was on his iPhone leaning against the bar. The sushi we got was par, nothing great. Mostly rice and crab meat which to me seems like a way to make us full faster. All in all we were both disappointed, to say the least.

Blue Fin is my go to sushi spot in Las Vegas.From the delicious spicy garlic tuna, to the creative yet tasty rolls. All the fish is fresh, from the super white tuna to the eel. I have been coming here even before the expansion when they were a little building. I suggest this place to any sushi lover or anybody who is looking to try a new sushi place.10 stars.

I'm ashamed to admit I have a prejudice. I believe the idea of all you can eat and sushi reflects on the quality of the products they use. I was wrong, so wrong, and I'm sorry it took me so long to see the light.
Blue Fin is a great establishment. The fish is incredible, I mean fresh, clean, and can balance traditional cutting method with inventive items. They already have a great menu, but are able to create items based on your personal taste that will blow you away. The service is incredibly friendly, and the chefs are so skilled. So glad I found them!

After our group of people (15 at minimum) waited over an hour at another place to be served our food, we decided to walk out and come here instead. We called as we were on the way and were told there would be no problem. 

We were able to sit in one large group (thanks to some awesome patrons who offered to move tables for us), but it was a bit cramped. 

I wish the place was a little bigger for the indoor only season (they have a nice patio, but it wasn't furnished at the time - not sure if it was for the season or if they don't offer outdoor seating). 

The flavors were amazing, as usual, and the service was exceptional. The server kept up with drinks while also keeping orders straight. They were friendly, upbeat and professional. They did not seem frantic or worried at any point. 

The only thing that keeps them from a 5 star rating is the time limit on their AYCE. I believe it's within 60 minutes... or 90. 

Considering they are a quick service establishment, I wont let this little detail keep me away!

This quaint sushi joint is my all time favorite in Henderson. They have the freshest fish, all you can eat and the chefs always remember us when we return and what we ordered last. They just expanded their space to accommodate the influx of sushi lovers. 

This was my hidden little secret, but the word got out and I am sooo happy for the owners and chefs. Don't let the outside of the building psych you out... Because you won't be disappointed by the greatness and the extensive menu selections.

Date night last night and Blue Fin did not let us down. Best sushi outside Nobu I've found. I really like nigiri & their Hamachi and salmon were amazing. My only complaint would be the different special sauces can be overpowering, but the sushi chef was happy to omit the sauce. AYCE is simple and reasonable.  Service was quick even though the place was packed. This place is an absolute winner.

Just went for ayce lunch. Have to say this is the best in Vegas. My son and I had about 12 different rolls. Some were tapa though. Every one was excellent. We devoured all of them. Well worth the $21.95. this will be my go to spot from now on.

The service was excellent, and the ambiance was pleasing. The food was great, too! Although I don't consider myself a sushi snob, I have had less than stellar sushi, and this was pretty darn good sushi.
Food was meh. Fish wasn't fresh. Rolls was sloppy. Mussels was yucky. Not recommended.

I promised Lisa L that I would try Blue Fin again, and it was on the way back from California (forgiveness please for the dilatoriness). While everything had a nice presentation and the service was VERY friendly, the taste was still not there.

I started with salmon sashimi, not the best piece of salmon ever but not the worst either and came with a pretty radish garnish. 

The server brought out edamame, a nice gesture and not commonly complimentary at sushi places. It was dried out but can't complain too much for the price.

Salmon skin salad was hefty, a whole lotta skin to go around. However, there was too much sauce again. The vinaigrette was overwhelming and permeated the greens completely. Imitation crab was just sad (a big let down after being in Maryland where there is shellfish aplenty), especially for a sushi place. Don't even try this at home.

Caterpillar roll also was drenched in eel sauce and it was impossible to taste the actual eel in it. I did like the generous amounts of avocado wrapped around it, but all I could taste was rice and sauce.

It is open late which is another plus, but I suppose not my cup of green tea (pun horribly intended).
Defiently a great spot to go if you like fun, upbeat, and quick service. Food came out quickly, and they always made sure that all my needs where attended to. Overall great place!

The star of the show here was the tempura ice cream. I have been dreaming about having this again since we came here. Besides that, I didn't care for this place too much. The fish was all drenched in vinegar, which I'm not a fan of. I prefer for them to use that sparingly. I could tell the fish was good but I couldn't really enjoy that when it was covered vinegar and sauces.

Absolutely amazing AYCE sushi with many other options. I have been here all times of the day, lunch and dinner on weekdays and weekends and have always had amazing service and great sushi. The fish is always fresh and they have great turn around time. I've been going to Blue Fin for years now and don't know of many other sushi places that can compare.
Love everything about this place. Freshest sushi I have ever had in Vegas. I suggest the firecracker roll for those who like deep fried rolls. My favorites are the salmon killer and the rainbow roll.

Been here a couple times, the sushi is great but service is horrible. Numerous times they've brought stuff to our table that we didn't order and we had to send it away. This last time the same girl kept bringing stuff that wasn't ours and even one time after sending her away
A waiter came over and rudely said " ,you didn't order that" and my boyfriend got a bit short with him because they were the ones who didn't have there shit together
Very good rolls but the frustration at their unprofessional service was not worth it and a gal who took our order came back 10 min later because she had forgotten part of the order just to have a more pleasant experience I'll stick with another place next time
Great sushi! Very fresh!  Clean place.. good all you can eat prices.  I had a great experience.
I'm very glad I popped into this place. I ordered sashimi sushi and the portions were very, very generous. I also had the volcano roll which was amazing. I'll definitely be back!

Love coming here. Found my favorite weekend dinner date. The waiters and the manager are always welcoming 
The food is always fresh and they're always happy to see us. Couldn't say one bad thing about this place. The later you go the less crowded it gets about (830ish)
Couldn't stop coming here. Still haven't burned out on this restaurant. And it only seems to get better every time we come back. 10/10 would eat again.

Going to update this review, we came here for dinner service tonight. The hostess sat us at a dirty table. We had the all you can eat option. 

We started our first set of orders with the: ahi poki salad, garlic tuna, crazy jalapeño. 

The next round we had volcano, Johnny Johnny,  and Dr.  After the first round, I did notice that they started to pile in the rice, to fill us up faster. 

All of our food was very good and was made very well. I'm dropping a star because of the hostess who sat us at a dirty table, took our first order and made us wait 15 minutes before she sent anyone else over to check on us.

I decided to try this place because the reviews spoke highly about the sushi but I'd have to say I've had better.  It wasn't completely bad but it wasn't the freshest. I'm giving it 3 stars because it's just that....3 stars.

Blue Fin struck me as one of many acceptable, but pretty much mediocre AYCE sushi establishments in Las Vegas. There are many of these and they are okay to go to if you happen to be in the neighborhood and are in the mood for stuffing yourself silly full of not GREAT, but still tasty fish bits.

But if we are talking about trying to find exceptional Japanese food experiences, then this isn't really the place for it. Subpar miso soup. Strange fluorescent green seaweed salad. Fish with not the freshest feeling texture. And fairly average sushi preparation. 

I've given them a try, but am now going to go back to some of the other better Japanese restaurants of which there are a few nearby.
Pretty good AYCE sushi place. There specialty rolls have a lot of extra sauce plus flavoring in mg opinion so I would ask for less or no sauce

Went for the first time with my boyfriend tonight, it was a great meal! We had the AYCE option and got multiple orders of nigiri; several orders of yellowtail [probably too many, but it's the boy's fave and sooooo good], salmon, tuna, uni, unagi, amaebi & octopus/tako. All were fresh, tasted sweet and the uni, unagi and amaebi were especially fabulous. The uni was the freshest I've had at any AYCE, with a glossy sheen and a lovely buttery, creamy texture and sweet, subtle flavor. Unagi pieces were large, supple, served warm with the sauce warm and thick. Normally not a particular fan of unagi, it looked so good that the boy couldn't resist. The amaebi were like the photograph, with a gorgeous sheen and transparent, tender flesh, as well as having the deepfried heads to the side. The boy was impressed by how the drops of batter on the end of the shrimp's whisker/spine looked like a flower. :} I ate the heads, and they were great- had a good flavor and were cooked perfectly. We also tried the Rock n' Roll and the Bluefin Special roll. The Bluefin special was the better of the two, with a great spicy sauce studded with lots of masago and herbs. Very flavorful & quite a big roll. The Rock n Roll was tasty, but it lacked the sauce that makes it truly outstanding. We were still happy to see it on the menu, though. At one point, we asked the chef to create a special of his choice for us and he made a roll with lots of yellowtail, masago, crab, herbs and other things. Very yummy. Tried the calimari tempura and baked green mussels as well. The calimari had a light crispy coating, not too greasy, and had a nice springiness without being too chewy. My boyfriend was particularly enamored with the presentation of the mussels, in a small bowl with little indents to hold the individual mussels in a bath of flavorful mayo sauce. Lastly, the poki salad was good. It was a combination of tuna, seaweed salad, shredded daikon, lots of herbs, and a flavorful sauce- and was another favorite of the boy. There were many layers of flavor, and it was different from the usual poki I run into. It was actually the first thing we tried and we were both rapidly impressed. 
It was quiet when we went, so the orders were prompt and we were given ample attention. As soon as we finished the waitress cleared the path for the next order, and both sushi chefs were friendly and chatted with us while we ate. Two other groups ate during the time we were there, which makes me glad because the food is GOOD, and this place needs to prosper! If you're in the area, go here for a good sushi meal, then drop by The Olive for a post-dinner drink and a hookah at reasonable prices. Awesome, awesome!

Love this place!!! Always fresh, exactly what you would expect from a great local sushi joint. During prime dinner time be prepared to take a seat and wait, but I promise you it will be worth the wait. They do have an all you can eat lunch/dinner special, personally I have never done it for 2 reasons. #1 - they will only serve you one roll at a time and will not bring you the next roll until you finish what is on your plate (I like to take my time and try a few different ones all at the same time). If you don't finish you can't take anything home and you will be charged for the full roll price. #2 - Between my husband and I, we will order 4 rolls (normally 2 specialties and 2 normals) and we are stuffed.
