Kicker is, we pay less than the all you can eat special, and that's with 2 beers. So doesn't really make sense for us. I'm sure if you came with a really big appetite you would eat your $$ worth. If you haven't tried this place already, there is no time like the present!

Wow!  Thanks Lisa for introducing us all to this place.  I'm just bummed I didn't make one of your UYEs sooner!  

I'm usually not a big AYCE fan.  Too much fried stuff, too many rules. But here they gave us anything we wanted, including salmon or yellowtail collar (1 per person but its huge!), for the bargain dinner price of $25.99.  And they were willing to customize everything, which was impressive.  Eric ordered some great salmon nigiri with avocado that was not on the menu.  You can order half rolls if you don't want to commit to a full roll. My favorite was probably the garlic tuna nigiri.  Yummy.  I could eat that all night.  We also had red and green tobiko.  Very Christmasy.  The only thing I will avoid in the future is a crazy yum yum sauce.  I should have taken Lisa's advice and got it on the side.  Too mayonnaisey. (I'm just making up all my words today!) We got some special rolls that were amazing.  One with chopped up soft shell crab and salmon.  Sooo good.

The other nice thing was that they have a variety of desserts and you can get as many as you want for the AYCE price.  Most places it is just mochi.  Their strawberries jubilee with caramelized strawberry sauce, vanilla ice cream, and a warm beignet... amazing!  

I did enjoy the fact that my dining companions did not have sushi phobia and didn't insist on ordering everything fried or with cream cheese like some of my other friends do.  That makes AYCE miserable for me because then they can't eat it all and look to me to help, which I don't want to do.  Service here was excellent and they don't enforce the 60 minute time limit or eat everything rule too strictly.  But still, it's rude to order a ton of food and then leave it on the table.  No worries with this crowd.  Great time, great place.  I'm definitely dragging my husband here.  He hates AYCE, but I'm sure he'll love this place.

All you can eat, made to order sushi!  hurray!  I can't stand sushi that has been sitting out on a buffet line, it's just not right!

First off the rice in the nigiri was a little bigger than i like, and seemed to be old, possibly reheated, but I guess thats to be expected at all you can eat.

The fish: they did not offer toro, but the Super White Tuna (Escolar, Walu if you're from Hawaii) more than made up for that, super soft, tender and buttery;  just don't eat too much, (google it, you'll see why) 1 or 2 orders per person should be fine.  Hamachi, Hirame, Tai, Salmon, unagi, were all good.  Spicy tuna hand roll was packed full to the top and is an attempt to copy the spicy tuna of Hawaii's genki sushi (the gold standard of spicy tuna).  It has sesame oil and tobiko for some texture.  The owner is from Hawaii, so i guess he would know.

I'm not one usually for rolls but i did get a few just to try.  I highly suggest you try the Yuri roll, a california roll placed on is side covered with avocado, scallop dynamite, and eel sauce.  Rich, fatty and delicious!

Appetizers, and desserts are all you can eat too!

I like their hours, 11 - 11, they don't close between lunch and dinner, so you can go whenever.  No ridiculous lines (at least for now), Friendly and attentive service.  I suggest you go here if you are tired of waiting in line at your fav AYCE sushi place.

Went here with a big group and were seated right away. The service was good. I would give the service 4.5 stars. The sushi was sub-par. The nigiri had very thin slices of fish and way too much rice. Every roll I ordered was drenched in sauce, perhaps to mask that the fish isn't very fresh. Again, waaaaaay too much rice! I feel like they want to stuff you with rice so you don't order so much for AYCE. I don't know why there are such fabulous reviews about this place. Perhaps because others haven't tried Goyemon or Yama or Sushimon. For those sushi connoisseurs please skip this place unless you have a hankering for a lot of sushi rice.

Blue Fin is a delicious tuna but not my favorite sushi place. I thought they were closed when we first walked in because we were literally the only couple there. We walked through an entire room of empty tables and were sat at a table next to the bar. I don't mind that at all - it helps the food come fast! The place filled up as we are, sort of. It was still half empty on our way out. We may have just come at a weird time but it was around dinner. 

Thier sushi is good, their fish is fresh. I don't have any complaints about that portion. Their rolls left something to be desired. Again, as usual, I ate everything but wasn't blown away by anything. Their service is average, which isn't a problem if your food is great but if your food is average you should at least make it up in service. The selection of appetizers is lacking. The only appetizer that I loved was the soft shell crab. The mussels tasted like cheese, and I know cheese normally comes on baked mussels, but this was not my style. I could hardly taste the mussels it felt like I was just eating melted cheese. 

I love that fried ice cream is included in the price, the normal sushi place I go to makes you pay extra for anything but mochi. We got vanilla fried ice cream and it came with chocolate syrup and whipped cream and was easily the most delicious and satifsying part of my meal.

First of all the service here is horrible.  The servers all seems to more like a robot.  They do not engage with the guest and have no personalities.  As for the sushi, I had the ayce and ordered few nigiri, special cut rolls and a couple of hand rolls, and it was all average.  No desert choices, which is a pity.  Small bottle of sparkling water cost about $4, which I feel is insane, knowing this place is not a fine dining establishment.  The outlet itself seems dated with no atmosphere and the music was overpowering which made the dining experience poor.  I would not recommend this place.  There are a lot of better sushi joints around town.

I love this place! We typically go to Yama Sushi, but since the word is out of what a great place they are, it's hard to get in there on any night for dinner, so we have been going to Blue Fin! Their AYCE is $25.99 per person I believe for dinner and includes everything on the menu. My favorite item on the menu is the garlic tuna and super white tuna. I'm still a sushi newbie for the most part, as I just began eating fish a little over a year ago for the first time in my life, so Nigiri/Sashimi is a little intimidating for me, seeing a big hunk of raw fish on a small round of rice. However, both are so delicious! Their super white tuna is so silky it melts in your mouth. My favorite rolls are the Royal Philly (deep fried philly roll), the Hawaiian Roll, and their new one called an Italian Roll.  It has (forgot what type of fish) but a balsamic oil on top of it. YUM!  
Also, if you like green mussells, or mussels in general, try their baked green mussels. My BF ordered 4 of these the first time he tried them, and the other day he ordered 3 of them. We even got a first time visitor to Blue Fin to rave about them.  They're shucked pieces of mussel in a tiny round dish with about 7 little wells each with a piece of mussel. It's then covered in what seems/looks like butter and/or mayo, and then some kind of cheese and baked. My BF loves it!  No restrictions on how many either. They also offer tempura ice cream in either green tea or vanilla. We had it last time and they had carmelized strawberries on it. Sooo good!  Definitely check it out!


***update***
12/27/11 - reading over my review to see if any of my Yelp friends have checked the place out yet, I noticed I said shucked when speaking of mussels. Apparently, I had too much sake that night.

I love Blue Fin. Just come here. End of review.

No really. Just come here. They have AYCE sushi. AYCE sushi is top secret code for we love feeding you sushi until you burst. They have some amazing sushi. 

Speciality sushi rolls are all the bomb. Ultimate blue fin, volcano, and *** are just some. Some of the rolls are loaded with sauce so just ask them for sauce on the side or ask for half roll as is.

I even did the hand rolls which comes in a stand that can hold 3 hand rolls and sometimes they're so big that the stand can't hold it so no stand is used. Try the salmon skin hand roll its good.

For nigiri all excellent choices. I had lots of nigiri uni with quails egg, tako octopus,... Get the garlic ahi nigiri drool.

The poke salad was ok. It was stretched out with lots of non-ahi ingredients like some of the other sushi spots here.

They didn't have oysters on the AYCE menu and I didn't order shrimp tempura but everything else was amazing enough to make me not care about it. 

For desserts they have red bean ice cream, not small scoops but regular size ice cream scoops. Mochi and fried tempura ice cream. All that are also AYCE.

So good that I almost did AYCE lunch the day after I did AYCE dinner. When's the next time. I'm actually craving sushi today. Next time has to be tonight LOL

Premature yelp review post. Noticed I wasn't finish.

The pros: fish to rice ratio on nigiri, service, quality of fish, green tea ice cream

The cons: $21/lunch, screaming o was covered in watery mayo, tuna poke had sliced carrots (but I like the seaweed salad addition), baked mussels were covered in mozzarella cheese, fried soft shell crab was a ball of fried oil, crab "meat" still looked like imitation crab (I've never pulled meat from a crab that looked like that), mochi was overly frozen

Overall I always order nigiri so I wasn't too disappointed by the things that I didn't like, I just prefer the traditional take on baked mussels and tuna poke. I will come back because it's near by new job and my sons preschool.

Lastly, I have to apologize to the staff because I was freaking out about lost sunglasses and I found them. My bad y'all. This means I have to tip more next time. Party foul.
We went on Valentine's Day and it was packed, but the service was great. The food was delicious and very fairly priced. We will be back.

The companion and I were looking to get some good sushi on our way out of town and AYCE definitely sounded great. We got a tip on this place from my friend Yelp so we drove across town to check it out.

We honestly thought it was closed because the parking lot was nearly as empty as the inside of the restaurant. However when we got inside we were guided to our seats at the sushi bar and greeted by a very exuberant sushi chef. We perused the menu for a moment and began the ordering frenzy. AYCE be damned, we were going for the gold.

After several rolls of varying shapes and sizes we began asking for suggestions. The chef is very amusing, often tempting us with other people's orders and simply saying "don't be shy, order more!" To which was happily replied, "oh we will... we will."

And we did this, through several different rolls. I have a couple of favorites:

White Tuna Nigiri: Super clean and fresh. Cut superbly and just melts in your mouth.

Unagi Hand Roll: As good as you can get anywhere. Definitely fresh and the sauce they drizzle on top is great.

Blu-Fin Special Roll: Perfection. Just try it and you'll understand.

We made an excellent decision to come here. I highly recommend you visit this place whether you're a local or a visitor. It may be a moderate drive across town, but the quality is worth the trek.
Sushi fresh flown in fron Hawaii.  Great prices.  Available parking.  Friendly staff.

A year and a half after asking Yelp where to get AYCE sushi, we finally got around to trying Blue Fin. We went at about 7 pm on a Friday and only waited about 5 minutes for a table. This was impressive, since this place is teeny tiny. 

The staff is super friendly and eager to serve. 

All in all, we ended up with: Rainbow roll, Tiger roll, White Tiger roll, Red Dragon roll, Caterpillar roll, and the Wet Dream roll, plus vegetable tempura. All of is was fabulous! The White Tiger roll is very garlicky and amazing. The Red Dragon is a must for tuna lovers. The Wet Dream is ultra rich and should be eaten while you have plenty of belly room. The only roll I didn't love was the Caterpillar; the eel sauce at Blue Fin tastes very caramel-y, something I don't love. 

The AYCE selection is really, really great. If you can't find a handful of rolls, hand rolls and nigiri that you like, you clearly don't like sushi as much as you think. Anyway, here are the details I couldn't find beforehand: AYCE has an hour time limit. There's a separate menu for it. They say that they'll charge you the full price of any roll you don't finish, but we didn't finish one and weren't charged for it. I don't get the impression that they're sticklers for the rules, which is great (as long as you don't abuse them!). Its $25.99 for dinner, $21.99 for lunch. 

We'll definitely be back!

My boyfriend and I moved here from SoCal and have been on the hunt for a good sushi spot. Well.... I think we found it!!! We decided to do the all you can eat sushi and I definitely think that's the best way to go! Our favorite rolls by far were, the gangnam style roll, mexican roll, and the wet dream! However, we were still not disappointed by the other rolls we ordered! Everyone from the servers to the sushi chefs were so nice. We will definitely be coming back!

Tonight I couldn't do AYCE so I go with their sushi combo.
It's set up menu so I couldn't change sushi but it's fair enough.
Tuna, slmon, shrimp, eel, yellowtail,  red snapper and I picked spicy tuna roll. It comes with miso soup and salad.
Sushi rice was good and fish was good too.
My other yelper friends did AYCE, so I can check their order with my own eyes. Everything looks good. 
Their service was good too. 
Next time I'll go for AYCE.
Way too much sugar. If you want to kill a diabetic friend or secretly want to fatten up your mate take them here. Everything was obnoxiously sweet to the point it masked the flavor of the fish.

Blue Fin was our first time dining. It was ABOLUTELY EXCELLENT!!!!! All you can eat!!!! We arrived and was greeted by everyone when we walked in the door. The service was absolutely excellent! The food was SO GOOD!!!! Such variety and the sushi rolls are so good!!!!!! The service was so fast! And the proportions were large and stacked with all the ingredients! We will Definately be BACK!!!!!!!
Consistently good. I enjoy having lunch here; the food and service reliably meet expectations and I leave happy -- Keep up the good work!
Been coming here for 4+ years! Never disappoints! Try their lunch combo or their royal California! They have AYCE as well! Just don't have the appetite for that!

Best All You Can Eat in Las Vegas!!!
If you like authentic Japanese food, try this restaurant.

I come here at least once a week since it's right by my office. I have never been disappointed! They have decent lunch specials for around $8 and it comes with miso soup and a salad. IDK what they put on the salad but I don't really care for it so I double up on the miso soup. 

The AYCE is a fair price at lunch and they have a large variety of food to choose from. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. 

Defffff check this place out if you get a chance!

What a great find!  Came in for lunch to wait for my car being repaired next door and was pleasantly surprised.  The food is very good and the portions are good as well.

My wife and I both ordered from the lunch special menu.  She had the 2 roll combo with Miso Soup and salad for $8.95.  The eel and spicy yellowtail were tasty.  And the also enjoyed the soup and the salad.

As I was not wanting Sushi, I opted for the chicken teriyaki bowl for $7.95 which also came with the soup and salad.

We will both come back here again.

Went for AYCE with Lily last night; completely worth the trip from Summahood to Hendertucky for this cute little spot I'd have easily driven past without Yelpers. (I did circumnavigate the building trying to find the front door...cuz I'm cool like that) For almost the whole time, we had the place to ourselves and that was great. Filled up later with obvious regulars. 

Now, I'd been waiting all day to chow down and try to thank Lilz for saving my life (AYCE = the international symbol for "I love you, man") and we were two chicks with a mission. We had: edamame, teryaki veggies, super white tuna, hamachi, salmon, halibut, tuna, & uni nigiri. All were very good: I really liked the fish:rice ratio and the rice was delicately flavored and held up nicely. Can always tell I'm loving my sushi when I don't even pour soy sauce. Mmmm. Neither had interest in the mayo/funny named rolls: instead Lily suggested the Salmon Skin hand roll "Sunnyside Up" (chef referred to adding yummy quail egg this way) This could be one of my new favorite things!!! So delish, textures & flavors galore. We finished out with a cucumber roll, both readying to throw in the towel. Those last few bits of rice were hard to manage: but we are badass!!! 

Of course all of that "I can't eat another bite" disappeared when I spied my kryptonite = strawberry mochi :))) Lily had the green tea tempura ice cream, which of course I HAD to taste and it was light and refreshing. 

The sushi chefs and servers were quick and friendly and even brought a whole pot of green tea to Lily while keeping my water full. Only a couple of misses: gyoza we did not order appeared and left, and they brought vanilla tempura (didn't ask which when she ordered) but cheerfully swapped it out. 

Only gave 4* because I didn't eat as much as I have @ UYE/I can't move feasts, but the quality of food and service lead me to believe I'll bump up on future visits. And there will be future visits when I'm lamenting my bud being in the City by the Bay...or just in the mood for some great eats with matching service. 

Thank you, Lily & Blue Fin!!'

*** Update. Lilz reminded me that we had the Amaebi (sp?!) aka "crunchy fried shrimp heads with eyes" I probably blocked this out cuz I don't like my food lookin back at me, but I ate the raw tails. Oink. ***

I used to come here at least once a week with coworkers for lunch.  It was our favorite spot.  They have lunch specials and food comes out fast.  Everything is fresh and tastes great.  Come early or late because it's a small place and they get packed.  Service is always good no matter how busy they get.  I wish I still worked in the area so I could come in more often.

Only have 5 words for you guys ALL YOU CAN EAT MOCHI!! that was sooo gnarly and loved it so much! The service was great and FAST! The workers were nice and friendly. The parking was some what convenient but a little bit packed!
   overall it's a great place to get together with friends and family I would definitely recommend this to a friend!

they added a new dining room and now sticking it to you . 5 times i went there last 1 1/2 yrs now the all you can eat 25.00 sucks . small piece of sushi fish , big barrel of rice . they watch you like a hawk too make sure you eat it . appetizers are terrible the mussels are cut in half and put in a snail dish hidden by chess ..tiny eneatable. soft shell crab is embarrassing . calamari tempura is horrible 93.00 for 2 ,ayce
 three large sapporo and a less than large sake  tiny fish   big rice  the oldest one in the book. was a cool place ,,,now forgettabout it go somewhere else ...if they will do that the fish has  to be old ..tasted like it.....and the rice huge barrels and hard pieces ,,,small fish.......................................................................................................................... and by they way these reviews  5 stars written like a journalism major wrote it ...please i've never see so many obvious reviews that are written by the staff of the owners friends
Quality AYCE. Nice selection and friendly staff. No Sashimi on the menu though. Drinks are priced decent as well. Small place and can get busy but food is fresh and tasty

I LOVE this place!!! I wish it wasn't so far, but everytime I can even think of a reason to go down to Henderson, I jump on the opportunity to go to Blue Fin. My husband and I have been here twice, and both times have had no wait, and sadly, not very many people. People are missing out by driving out and waiting for an hour for a table at Goyemon. The fish here is SO fresh and their pieces of Uni are always big, overflowing, and fresh. The fish to rice ratio is fair unlike some places where I have to take out the rice from my nigiri (and then pray I don't get charge). When my husband and I came last, we ordered a ton of nigiri and a sushi chef would always give us cuts of sashimi on the side of that fish. It was much appreciated!! 

Although my husband and I often order nigiri (our favorites are white tuna, spicy tuna, halibut, sweet shrimp, and UNI!), we also tried some of their rolls. The white tiger was very yummy and so were the fresh rolls that I don't remember, but they have some very yummy and appealing rolls on the menu. When my husband and I ate at an unnamed sushi spot last week, I looked at all the rolls and they all sounded disgusting and once again, I wished I was at Blue Fin. The service is SO fast! I love it! It seems like with a snap of a finger when you sit at the sushi bar, you will receive your food. The first time my husband and I came, we were in and out within 45 minutes because they just kept handing over our orders. The second time we took it a little slower, but were there for barely an hour. Overall, I love this place! If it was closer, it would be my go-to sushi spot. If you're ever in Henderson, definitely give it a try!

Blue Fin Sushi & Roll is my family's go to spot when we're craving some sushi! We usually go for dinner and always do the AYCE which is $25.99 per person around that time of day. You definitely get your money's worth when you do the AYCE versus ordering à la carte.

The good thing about the AYCE option is that things like appetizers and desserts are also included in the menu whereas most AYCE joints in Vegas only include the sushi or are very limited to what you can choose from. The appetizer menu includes the usual edamame, Miso soup, shrimp tempura, and vegetable tempura. We always order a few to tie us over while waiting for our sushi, which comes out pretty quick! We've never waited long. As for the sushi... Wow! Blue Fin has a wide variety to choose from, which makes it so hard to order! Every. Single. Time. A few of our favorites include the Red Dragon, CM 4 Ever, Tiger, and the Fire Cracker which is a deep fried roll. The fish is always fresh and sliced to perfection! Each whole roll is 8 or so pieces which is definitely enough to share! (Or not) Some rolls are even available in half portions if you ask! If you have room for dessert, the tempura vanilla ice cream is a must. They also offer different flavors of mochi ice cream too!

Not only is the food great, but the customer service is quite exceptional. Each time we've had dinner here, Omar has been our server. He always takes great care of my family when we come in! The entire staff is awesome. They are constantly making sure that your order is tasting great and your empty plates are removed in a timely manner! 

Blue Fin is always on point!

I've been officially rice & imitation crab bombed thanks to Scammy Mc. Scammerson. This place scams the hell out of your tastebuds, stomach space & money. We were trying to explore a new AYCE sushi spot for my fiancé's birthday dinner, but we totally regret cheating on Sakana. I'm extremely aggravated from our experience here - they seriously get no love from me.

The nigiri & rolls here are horrendous! Skip all of the nigiri if you care about your stomach. Rice city! They stuff you silly with rice denser than a rock, topped off with paper thin nigiri & an ungodly amount of imitation crab meat - what the hell!!

Plus all of the appetizers we tried were terrible. The measly soft shell crab (soft shell crap) was overwhelmed with breading and dripping in oil. The miso soup tasted like warm water. The bland baked mussels were topped with a nasty rubbery cheese, swimming in oil and presented like vomit on an escargot plate. Also, what's going on with the rock & roll? It looked nothing like any of the pictures on yelp - we were served a brick of imitation crab and a dot of tuna smaller than my pinky nail and a side of gross thick mayo (cream of sum yung gai) that tasted like artificial sweetener. Same thing with the screaming orgasm - their sweet mayo default is awful! And of course the orange salmon roll was stuffed to the max with imitation crab meat and garnished with a paper thin slice of salmon. Regrets! I have them! 

The proof is in all of the pictures I uploaded. Absolutely disgusting. I was extremely offended by every single item of food that was brought to us, all of it. We ended up having to spit out a ton of rice into about 6+ napkins and we left upset and unsatisfied.

Also to top off an awful birthday dinner in BFE, our waitress had attitude for days. I read several other reviews that mention rude service from a women here - probably the same atrocious lady. Why is she even in the service industry? Serving food?! Why!!??? I seriously can't stand this place. Get me out of here!

PRO TIP: if you care about quality AYCE sushi without all of the cheap fillers - I highly encourage trying our top spot for AYCE sushi: Sakana (on Maryland) it's like night and day compared to this place.

I had lunch at Blue Fin Sushi while on my way to an appointment. But to my surprise I stumbled onto a well-designed resto, clean, nice bathroom, with delicious and fresh sushi and excellent terriyaki chicken. I'll have to come back for dinner next time.

Fresh and inventive menu in an intimate space - just how I like my sushi.  However, I find many of their items borderline fusion.  So if you like cream cheese and truffle vinaigrette on your rolls, then this is your place. I would definitely go back for yellowtail  belly sushi.  It's not on the menu so ask if they have it.  Great service.

Good food, good prices, good atmosphere - I usually stop in here for lunch during the week and have been meaning to write a review for a while. Service is fast and I've never had any complaints about the food. My only complaint is my complete inability to do anything other than be in a food coma after doing the all you can eat for lunch!

So I ate here about a year ago and I was honestly not thrilled with the experience. They slap the special sauce on everything and it is honestly just covering all the rolls. The fish had a very fishy taste to it which to me does not mean it is very good quality. 

Now I left a review on their Facebook page afterward and gave my honest opinion, that it wasn't good and I'd rather eat at another spot, Kaizen. Ok so fast forward almost a year later, I wake to see them comment on my post on their page. I figured it would be a generic comment like, "I'm sorry you had this experience please come back and let us try again" type deal. No! The person from Blue Fin shamed me for leaving a comment and accursed me of being a paid troll by the competition. I couldn't believe it. They touted all of their other five star reviews and that there was no way they could get a one star review. I get that a lot of people like this place which is why I went. I just so happened to have a poor experience. They clearly need to learn how to handle poor reviews better because this is not the way. Picture included.

This is by far my favorite sushi restraunt in Las vegas. I get the ayce option every time I come and am never disappointed. The fish is always served cold and fresh. The rice to fish ratio is great. The customer service could do better but I'm here for the food.

What a great experience.  I have heard of this place many times from people, know the neighborhood, so finally decided to try.  It was a fun night out with friends with lots of laughter.  The service was excellent, granted it wasn't crowded at all which surprised me for a saturday night, but the entire staff was helpful and worked together well keeping our glasses full and the food coming out efficiently.  
We started with the Screaming orgasm appetizer, and the tuna poke.  The sauce on the screaming O was different but still very good, the poke came with seaweed salad and had a nice kick with flavorful spices.  
We ordered a bunch of rolls as we all got AYCE and just went family style.  From the red dragon roll, to the rock and roll, the sunset, johnny johnny, and the tokyo express were the only ones I remember someone ordering.  I didn't taste them all but the ones I did were great and flavorful and I know everyone else was happy and satisfied.  My favorite was the rock and roll as no rice and so light and refreshing.  The cucumber wasn't overwhelming the fish either.  
No five stars as the rock and roll is the only one without rice and you can only order one Screaming O and poke per AYCE.  Also compared to some other places we have all been together the dessert choices included were only average.  One of the guys even said the mochi was very dense.  
But we made it fun and enjoyed a good meal with lots of laughter.  They only have one bathroom though so be careful how much you drink as we were waiting for someone who drank too much! 
I would definitely go back as variety is great and a very positive experience

Another great meal here. Favorite things are squid karage and hand rolls. Great service and food comes out quickly. Manager is nice guy and sent my friend out something he thought she might enjoy, and she did! Go eat here!

As far as AYCE sushi, this place gets 5 stars from me. I'm not a fan of AYCE sushi, I was pleasantly surprised how good everything was here. Came with a group of 6 AYCE-aters one night, so we were able to sample a little bit of everything. 

Soft Shell Crab Tempura
Screaming Orgasm
Salmon Skin Salad
Calamari Tempura
Uni
Amaebi
Salmon Nigiri
Agedashi Tofu
Yellowtail Belly Nigiri
Salmon Belly Nigiri
Spicy Scallop Handroll
Salmon Skin Handroll
Tempura Ice Cream
Mochi

Out of all the sushi we had, this place did not dissapoint. Everything tasted really fresh. With our large group, and mutiple orders, the staff was very efficient. We didn't have to wait to long for our orders and my iced green tea was refilled often.

This place blows away Goyemon (which is beyond my comprehension why people dine at that dump). I would definitely come back here.

Very large extensive AYCE menu which also includes dessert!! My group and I weren't very hungry so we didn't want to tackle the AYCE menu so we ordered a la carte. However when the bill was all totaled and done we spent the same amount of money if we would have done AYCE- lesson learned. 
The Volcano roll was probably my favorite. It was lightly fried on the outside which gave it a good crunch and it was different from all the other rolls we tried that night. 
One thing that I did notice is that blue fin uses a lot more sauce than most other sushi joints- we got an Over the Rainbow roll which is your typical rainbow roll but it was served with the chef's special sauce which was plentiful and a little overpowering at times. 
Also- I didn't think the tempura ice cream was too successful. The tempura part did not cook right and was just too soggy. I've had this at other sushi restaurants with much better success. But I did enjoy the green tea ice cream

Blue Fin Sushi Rocks !!  One of the Hidden Sushi Bars for Locals. I love Recommending Friends and Family. With Fresh Hawaii Big Eye Tuna Bright Red and Freshest Qualities For Sushi Bar, Blue Fin I Visit Daily and i also see Same Customers and we Agree, Blue Fin Rocks !!!   I Love Blue Fin Sushi
Love bluefin every time!! Never disappoints. I have been coming here since they first opened the doors. Never go anywhere else! Keep it up!!!

For the Green Valley & Sunset Rd area this is a good place for AYCE sushi.  Stopped in for lunch and the food continues to be good.  Everything looked and Tasted fresh. Ended lunch with their fried ice cream!  Good stuff!

Possibly the best $25.99 I have spent. The sushi was delicious. They have a very good menu and variety of rolls plus appetizers and if you want dessert it's also on the AYCE menu. The wife isn't fond of sushi in the least but the chicken teriyaki is tender and flavorful. I usually go to Yummy on Rainbow but I was in Henderson and thought I would try this out. Glad I did. You will be as well. All the staff are very friendly.

Just got done eating here. Our avacado roll was hard, they brought us the wrong roll and seemed to not really care about us. There was one skinny asian lady there that was really sweet so I gave 3 stars instead of 2.. the sushi wasn't that good. Mochi was good. I just wasn't impressed.

Stopped in for a lunch pick-up due to short window in which I needed to return back to work. First time going, but have passed the place many times before. Accommodating gentleman at the door took my order at the door. Ordered a spicy salmon roll, and added some extras to it. No problem! Then the gentleman suggested the current special witch doubled my order for only $3 more...sold! I went to truck for maybe 5min and returned to my order ready and bagged. Now that's what I'm talking about! Got to work and had a great lunch, plus I made it back in time!

Best in Vegas for AYCE and best in Vegas period if you go omakase. Ive been to SEN of Japan, Osaka (Henderson) which I will say are the only other excellent sushi restaurants in Vegas. Blue Fin is best value for your money and the chef is the most creative in town. Ask for something a little different he blow your mind! If you go anywhere else you are wasting your $$.

I am I BIG sushi fan and this is so far one of the best places to go for amazing sushi. Why the four stars though? Well, sometimes we would get sushi that we didn't even order and then the table next to you got that sushi. For example, you ordered a California roll, the other table ordered a 007. The waiter comes back with the 007 for you. What I would recommend for the waiters is maybe put numbers on the table to help memorize which sushi belongs to which table. Back to the sushi, one word: Amazing! We had the all you can eat and we had nine rolls of sushi. Those rolls were 3 California rolls, Tuna, Spider, 007, Royal California, Sweetheart (I think that's what it was called), and and another roll (I forgot what it was called). So, my favorite out of all those rolls is a tie to 007 and Spider. But if I could only eat one, it would be the Spider roll. That's how delicious it was. I would totally come back!!

Great food, good prices, friendly atmosphere. I come here fairly regularly. The all-you-can-eat is new-ish but amazing. 
The lunch special is pretty incredible. 2 rolls, miso soup, big salad, edamame, and and orange for dessert. All for under $10!
The place is small and quaint. It doesn't take long before they start to recognize you :)

It's easy to miss the sign for this neighborhood sushi joint on Sunset.  In fact, the first time we ate here, it was after we passed the place 5 times because we mistook Blue Fin for Checkers, which is located next door.  I am so glad we drove by that 6th time!! 

While there is certainly an ACYE option, which looks great, my man and I trust Jin, sushi-chef extraordinaire and proprietor, to surprise us every time we eat at this fine establishment.  To his credit, he never disappoints... and surprise he certainly does! His handroll creations (his spicy yellowtail with special sauce and shiso-tuna handrolls are our favs) are excellent.  But, his take on a sashimi salad (one specially named for me) takes the cake.  I'm admittedly biased - wouldn't you be if you had a salad named after you?  But, then again, you can't be all that biased when this particular sashimi salad is made up of a spicy tuna poke nestled in fresh greeens, a medley of generous cuts of salmon, tuna, yellowtail (and whatever other fresh fish is at his disposal that day), and a dash of truffle-oil! We are also big fans of his cajun albacore sashimi, which is spiced to perfection, and his signature Blue Fin roll (it's the cilantro flavoring that gives this roll its extra boost).

The staff at Blue Fin is friendly and extremely family-oriented.  In fact,  Jin and his lovely wife, Yura, often work side-by-side to ensure a great resto experience.  The rest of the staff is also pleasant and always aim to please.

My only tip for improvement: get a bigger sign so that more people can discover your wonderful restaurant!!

All You Can Eat for $25 a person. You must try the Blue Fin Special.

I came here for a UYE and Blue Fin's anniversary for some sushi and karaoke.  The place is very cozy and probably seats no more than 50 people, so be prepared to sit elbow to elbow if you're in a big group or be prepared for it to get loud when it's busy. I loved their nigiri selection, and the specialty rolls.  

Overall I had a great evening , had great sushi and sang a few tunes of karaoke.  Will definitely be on my top sushi spots to hit up again!

My friend introduced me to this place about 5 years ago & it became my favorite sushi spot ever since. I was tired of Yama Sushi, which is great but I was just over it, so I was glad to find this place.

I introduced my boyfriend to sushi at this place & well, it's been our favorite! The rolls are awesome, food is always fresh & my boyfriend's personal favorite is that our gyoza is always super crispy! The only reason I don't give it 5 Stars is because we've never had consistent amazing service. Sometimes we have to wait up to 10 minutes after finishing a roll to have someone even glance at our table unless we call a server over. So the service is hit or miss, never a rude employee just not as attentive to us. But the food is great & I love that the place is usually never super packed, at least in my experience.

Favorite rolls: Crazy Yum Yum, Gangman Style, Golden Tiger, Royal Shrimp But the whole menu is delicious!!!! Also, must try the gyoza & their nigiri is always fresh!

Very good service, great people and food. Nice to hit up a sushi place and feel welcomed. Will be back for sure. Spicy albacore and spicy tuna were great. Poke is great with a little spice.
This place is well worth the money.
This place is just ok I prolly won't go back the poki salad fish was cut too thick and the fish wasn't fresh

Ordered from the ala carte menu -Beef teriyaki combo, and 3 rolls. Also wanted to try the tempura ice cream, eck! Fail! Food was ok but the service needs improvement. Waiters kept on forgetting what we asked for and never got back to us (place wasn't even busy).

I write this as an outsider: a Californian looking for a place to eat in Vegas. When I saw a Yelp rating of 4.5 stars for this place, I bookmarked it as a possible visit. This is my review...

My girlfriend and I arrived here on a Saturday. Plenty of parking spaces available, parked right by the door. Inside was pretty much the same. The sushi bar was full, but there were plenty of table seating.

The decor has some elements that make me presume that this was once a small French bistro. The doors for the individual male and female restrooms have characters wearing berets. An outdoor patio has some decorative lamps that certainly isn't Japanese inspired.

Seeing as how there's a 1 hour time limit, we set our timers at 12:30pm. We probably stayed a slight but longer than that, and they weren't strict about kicking us out.

The target audience of this restaurant is aimed more towards local Las Vegans than tourists. There are some good things to be said about selecting this place over casino buffets. All you can eat sushi. Certainly cheaper. No fighting for parking. Friendly service (our waitress was always around). Clean facilities. No waiting in line. No gasping for air because of smokers.

BUT... it is far from the Strip. While the cuts of the fish look aesthetically appealing, the quality of the fish is spotty: some great (yellowtail), others okay (super white tuna, tobiko, masago), others not (salmon, ikura, shrimp).

There were a few items that weren't included on the lunch menu, such as uni, sweet shrimp, and something called the "Screaming Orgasm". I mainly don't go for the specialty rolls, so I can't really speak out for those. I did order the One item that stood out for me was the crab meat sushi. Mmmm, that's not something you normally see. Wished those were more common.

Lunch is $21.99 and dinner is $25.99. Decent price. Noted on the menu is a charge if you leave leftovers.

Service is good, as our waitress kept coming back. One sign of good service is never having to ask for your own refill, and she certainly was attentive to keep checking our table. Which isn't hard since we were pretty much the only occupied table. Not that I'm complaining, just making an observation.

Dessert items are also included with the sushi gorging, which includes several variations of mochi and ice cream. As we got our bill, we were also served with orange topped with plum juice. 

That being said, the place isn't bad at all. I ate my fill and then some. But speaking as an out-of-state visitor, it might be worth the trip if you happen to be in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so.
I highly recommend this AYCE.  Great ahi poke salad and desserts.  Wow on everything plus great service to boot! We will be back!!! Hopefully soon.

Blue Fin Sushi & Roll is literally in the middle of nowhere in Las Vegas (definitely a trek off strip). We made the trip for their AYCE sushi lunch.

For about $20 you get an hour of AYCE sushi, which includes rolls, sushi nigiri, appetizers, and dessert. The only limitations were that a few pieces of fish are not offered during the lunch hour. Rolls can be requested to be made as half rolls, except for fried ones. Options for appetizers include edmamme, fried tofu and miso soup. Dessert options included oranges, ice cream, mochi ice cream and tempura ice cream!!

The cucumber salad was just ok, but the boyfriend loved the crab meat on top! The seaweed salad was over dressed. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_...)

Pass on the fried tofu, they texture is not the silky kind and they literally fry a large piece of tofu rather than two or three small pieces. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_...)

The salmon tasted funny (http://www.yelp.com/biz_...)

The garlic tuna was amazing (http://www.yelp.com/biz_...)

Baked green mussels were rich, pass on it (http://www.yelp.com/biz_...)

They have patio seating, but let's be real it's always too hot in Vegas to sit outdoors ;) 

Blue Fin Sushi & Roll is probably a great place for locals who work around that area, but not worth a special trip off strip if you are just visiting.
One of the best sushi restaurants i ever been to i just love the cali crunch roll it was the best good job guys

We like Blue Fin a lot. We found it when our last go to place started ending up in the restaurant report for violations.  Word to the wise: foodborne illnesses from seafood can mess you up. Just say'in. Happy to say we've been going here for years and it's all good. The fish is always fresh and they keep the AYCE orders flowing. I saw a review where the lady complained that the fish was sliced too thin but that wasn't my experience.  It all looked great, see my pictures. TIP: when we go to eat sushi we order accordingly : if you like the fish (hubby) get nigiri or hand rolls. If you're new to sushi start with the cooked rolls. If you like it mixed with all sorts of stuff (me), get the rolls. Whatever you like they have it. They do have some of the traditional Japanese dishes like teriyaki (for your newbie friends who are afraid of sushi) but make no mistake, sushi's the star here. Blue Fin's menu may not be as extensive as other places but what they do, they do well.

I was truly hoping to fall inlove with this place because it is so close to my house.. 

I ordered thru postmates for delivery which I was happy with.. however the food itself was a total let down.

not including delivery I paid $35 for 3 things.. Not super worth it.

Oh Blue Fin, what can I say about you? Lisa L takes me here, oh about every other day. Best sushi I've ever had. We usually do the AYCE option, priced at $26. Each time I go I've had a mix of pieces, handrolls, and the full rolls. Alaskan and Arizona are 2 of my favorites. All of the fish is really fresh, and Jin always throws in some bonus thing for us, usually not even on the menu. Blue Fin just passed its two year anniversary. Definitely worth checking out!

In town on business, found good reviews on Yelp.  Ordered the chefs 'A'.  Was not disappointed!! Starters with a bowl of edamame.  Miso soup and a small salad next. Dressing on the salad was tangy and crisp!  
6 piece spicy tuna roll. Tuna was fresh and fatty.  Excellent.  Then a 9 pieces of sashimi.  Not sure what they all were, but they were great!
I really do enjoy the sushi here.  It is nice to stop at a place and have AYCE with heavy portions and happy employees.  I will definitely stop in again when I am nearby.

I eat sushi OFTEN!! The service is outstanding. I tipped the guy. 20 I thought it was so good. The all you can Is the entire menu!! 

I would give it a 5 the only reason I didn't Is that the sushi isn't as fresh as I would of liked.  Everything was still very good, I just thought the product could of been a notch up. However it's a small little place and they do the best they can

I come here twice a month . The staff is wonderful and the SUSHI is the best. I usually get the all you can eat lunch/dinner. The place is limited seating and is usually full. I love the Grand Canyon, Wet Dream and the green tea or Vanilla fried ice cream . I always leave full and happy that is why I come as Often as I can .

I have never had a bad experience here. I always sit at the sushi bar so I can talk to the chef's and get my food quickly. They do not overload the sushi with rice like many other AYCE places do. A meal+ a beverage run about $30 a person before tip so it is not something I can get as often as I would like. I stick to the sushi because I can watch the chef's make it, although I am sure the stuff that comes from the back is decent. It is a small place and is usually full until 8pm or so.
Love this place! Would give 10 stars if possible. All the food is delish, serving sizes are good, staff is great.

This is a great sushi place to eat. I really love Japanese lasagna rolls and they have perfected that. I loved their baked rolls as well however they are too filling. If you are going to get AYCE don't load up on al the baked rolls because the tempura will fill you up. They are also fairly huge in size for a roll. Although they only give you five pieces for certain baked rolls they fill you up in an instant. They do this really cute thing with their orange. Ask for a sliced orange and their presentation of that is really cute :)

We went for lunch and it wasn't super busy which was nice. I read some reviews that were complaining about price and the sushi... I personally thought it was a good value, they have a lot of yummy rolls and the fish was very fresh. I will be eating here more often for sure.

Yelp, you have failed me!  I had such great hopes before visiting -- from all of the 4 and 5 star reviews and from the consistent Sushi threads in the talk forum.

I think what happens is that the trend reviews really skews reviewer's perception.  Either that or I just went on an off day.

In regards to overall atmosphere, appearance, quality of food, and variety, Blue Fin doesn't come anywhere close to Goyemon.   This is coming from someone who believes that Goyemon has been on the decline of late.

I left Blue Fin full, feeling sick, and wanting my money back.  What the hell is in the sauce on your eel and rolls.  Do they put cornstarch in there to thicken it?  The Udon soup tasted foul as well.  The fry they use in their soft shell crab and agadashi tofu was definitely not japanese.  

The only saving grace of this place was their salmon skin salad which was delicious.  Still, there is no reason for me to come back.   There's probably 100 sushi AYCE places in Vegas and I would rate Blue Fin as average.
Lunch was great. Restaurant is clean and spacious. Menú is clear. Service was quick. And food was very tasty.

Looked on Yelp and decided to give this place a try on our vacation to Vegas and let me say that this place didn't disappoint. The all you can eat menu was great. We all left stuffed and happy. The service was also very quick. The only thing that was not good was the tuna garlic nigiri. The fish eggs were delicious though! Over all it was a great experience.

The best Sushi ever & that's hard to believe since in the middle of the desert!
They have Fried Chicken thats also a must.
They even have bombay steaks
If your in town it's a must if your a fan of Sushi.

My Dad & I had lunch here on Father's Day and we loved this place. It was cozy and clean, everyone was friendly. they even made my dad's his own specialty roll he basically told the sushi chef what ingredients he wanted in it and he made it for him right away with no problem at all. I will come back for sure!!!

I had a wonderful time at Blue Fin Sushi. Our server was awesome and so friendly, and even with our large party, she managed to serve us with no problems. I don't know whose brilliant idea it was, but the server brought everyone at our table a complimentary appetizer created by the chef. The appetizer was a mix of rice, tuna & seaweed slivers all mixed together with a drizzle of truffle oil and some other seasonings. It was yummy. 

I ordered the Sushi Special Combo- 7 pcs Sushi- Tuna, Yellowtail, Salmon, Albacore, Eel, Shrimp, White Fish with California or Spicy Tuna roll and miso soup and house salad. I opted for the Spicy Tuna roll. I never got my miso soup, but I didn't mind because the complimentary appetizer was far better. The sushi, itself, was okay. The fish tasted fresh, but I didn't really find the rice to be good. I've had better sushi elsewhere. 

For the sushi alone, I would give three stars, but the friendly service and special appetizer bumped this review up to 4 stars. Also, the rolls looked tasty.I would definitely come back to Blue Fin Sushi, just not for nigiri sushi.

Let me start off by saying I secretly fantasize about Blue Fin every single day. This place floats like a butterfly and stings like a bee! This was my first REAL sushi experience because I always thought I was allergic so needless to say I was terrified! I was really nervous that I wasn't going to enjoy it and insult the chef by spitting it out or choking it down (You dirty birds).  Quite the opposite happened. Not only was it completely tolerable, but I FUCKING LOVED IT!!! 

We did the AYCE and I don't recall everything I tried, but here are some of the highlights: 

Ahi Tuna Salad- This was the first thing I tried and was surprised by the delicate texture of the tuna combined with the crisp cucumber. Off to a good start. 

Rock n Roll- My favorite roll there probably because it had some sort of mayo on it and rice which are both on my cheat list usually. It was all wrapped in cucumber. If I wasn't dieting I would have ordered more. This is the roll I fantasize about the most. 

Spider Roll- Crunchy goodness. Nuff said. 

Teriyaki Chicken- Hands down the best I've had. It was so moist and not overwhelmingly sweet or greasy. What a perfect option for those non-sushi eaters(FYI- You are on the wrong team!) 

Lastly the sashimi.....OMG. The chef sent this over special for us because I was with one of us that eats here often. It was yellowtail simply drizzled with truffle oil and melted like butter on my tongue and that's when Blue Fin and I had a moment..... Up until then everyone at the table was watching the nonfish girl eat fish and I was trying to be graceful about the chewing, etc. . Not now. I wanted to eat it with my hands like Animal from the Muppets. Animal like sushi!!!! Being the lady I am, I contained the inner Animal, but it was still apparent to the table that this was my favorite. Probably the drooling noises gave me away. 

All of the fish was so fresh and the presentation showed the pride they put in to each dish. Five star experience from start to finish and I highly recommend it to everyone I know and don't know. Thank you Blue Fin and Willis for turning me into a huge sushi fan!!!

Service was 10/10 and the price is reasonable. My only complaint is the "chef's special sauce". The rolls that contain this sauce just tastes like it was drenched in soy sauce.

You can see in the picture that the roll is drenched in this sauce. Disappointing as this roll is their signature roll.

Our family loves sushi, we have tried many places. I am not a fan of AYCE usually because I find the rolls are never as good or fresh as places that do not offer that option. This place is the exception!!! AYCE is Excellent here!! Best part, you can order half rolls 3-4 big pieces so your able to try a lot. Delicious rolls, fair prices especially at lunch, fresh, cold sushi w/ wonderful flavors, good service. I took my 17yr old son who AYCE is great for. A romantic date, probably not my first choice. It was clean & had a comfortable casual feel.

My boyfriend and I dropped in here last night after receiving the rudest service we've ever had  at the The Olive restaurant across the street (more on that in my profile if you'd like specifics). Let's just say that this place was a breath of fresh air from the moment we walked through the door and were greeted by a very wonderful, friendly hostess. 

We've never been here and everything on the menu looked wonderful so we asked the sushi chef what he recommended. He was very knowledgeable about the menu, as well as what fish was freshest, and was able to recommend two rolls that we LOVED: Their signature Blue Fin roll and the Wet Dream. Of the two, I liked the latter better. It was like a creamy party in my mouth! We also had a Yellow tail Hand Roll and some Ikura, both of which were very tasty as well. 

The service and food were top notch and we will definitely be returning for some AYCE soon!
This is my sushi spot! Clean venue! Amazing staff! My husband and I have been here over a dozen times and their food is consistently the best! Please try their volcano roll!

To quickly summarize, staff is impatient and mediocre food. 

I absolutely love naked fish sushi bar but it's on the other side of town so I've been desperately trying to find a place that can come close. I always drive passed this place so I figured I'd give it a shot, definitely regret walking in. A few things:

-it was freezing inside
-the tap water had a weird taste. Maybe it was the glasses? Stil, yuck.
-Service: ok once you ordered but until them they stare at you and constantly come over to see if you're ready. Note, their menu is HUGE. It took me almost 10 mins to look thru the menu. 
-menu caters to AYCE ($26 dinner) because the prices are so high. All rolls are over $11. You can half certain rolls btw.
-rainbow roll: unfortunately I halfed this roll, it was the better of the two rolls I tasted but was nothing special.
-happy ending: far from it! Weird flavor combo. A vamped up Philadelphia roll with lemon slices and garlic ponzu sauce. It was mainly a garlic and lemon roll since they over powered the rest of the roll and left a bad taste in the mouth. 

I was not impressed unfortunately. With all the great reviews, my hopes were high.

I really REALLY wanted to like this place. It's so close to home and had such good reviews. Why does it have such good reviews?! The fish tasted so old and the rice tasted stale! Super white and garlic tuna are my favorites. I should NOT have to chew the super white as much as I did there. And the rolls... Like I said, the fish tasted old and the rice was just dry and gross. So what they do, is they over saturated their rolls with way too much sauce. The rolls were so soggy, I literally gagged a couple of times. I've just been so spoiled with knowing some of the best spots in town, that this place just extra disappointed me. Please don't waste your money here. It really is that bad. Premade store bought rolls are better. Only getting a 2, because the servers were pretty good.

Super cheap sushi, rolls and all kinds of food. Always clean and always great sushi! The sushi bar is awesome and their tv is a great size to watch the game on while eating. Definitely eat here again!

Great lunch special. I always get 2 sushi rolls (spicy tuna and a crunch), small salad and soup for under $10. Service is fast. The salad is great... real lettuce (not pointless iceberg) string candied beets, and the dressing.

This place is pretty good if you ask me... I've driven by several times and always wanted to eat here. 

Well we went in on a Friday afternoon and were the only ones in there... Maybe it was just a slow day, but from reading all the reviews I was kinda shocked that it was dead in there haha. Anyways, the sushi tasted really good and so did the fish... We got ayce and I can't really tell you exactly which rolls I got, but I wasn't a fan of the one wrapped in cucumber instead of the usual... Also wayyyyy too much sauce on it.... It kinda looked like milk all over haha... every other roll was good though so no big deal...

They are very friendly and attentive here, which if you read my other reviews, is a major thing with me. I think the only reason why I took a star off was bc the edamame we ordered seemed old and not very fresh and their low-sodium soy sauce tasted like they had normal soy sauce and added water to it to dilute it...I could be crazy but just tasted odd. Other than that it was great! I'll probably go here again whenever I'm on this side of town. Cheers!
Fantastic food, fantastic staff, always consistent,  highly recommend all you can eat.

I am not sure why it took me so long to review this place, but here goes. The all you can eat sushi is really a treat, huge variety and everything is fresh and well prepared. Service for lunch or dinner is always prompt, but it can be a bit too much service if that makes any sense. Tonight we came in around 7pm and it was not very busy, just a few other patrons having dinner. We were seated right away, served right away and finished plates were removed from the table within seconds of taking the last piece! Super service to the max. Sushi is always fresh, (although we did have one occasion where we both got a bit of Motezuma's revenge, but we will overlook that somehow). Yeah, I know, but no one is perfect and we won't hold a grudge.
There lunch specials are just right in portion and the price is about the 10 dollar mark, which is really good for a decent sushi lunch with soup, salad and 2 rolls that come out on a sushi boat dish.
The place used to be tiny with just a few tables, but now they can handle a good size group if they have to and  often there are some large parties being served. Overall, minus a star for the overly eager service and the non traditional music they play gets a little distracting and does not really fit the decore or atmosphere for dinner. The all you can eat is a grear value and I am sure some big eaters can really do some "damage". The place is really popular and for good reason, we like it and have been dining here for a few years now.
This is my go-to place when I feel like eating sushi. I love the volcano roll and the yura roll is my favorite. Is the iced green tea is great as well.

We vacation here all the way from idaho a couple of times a year. We stumbled across this place and it was amazing.  We have been alot of places and tried sushi all over. This is the best sushi we've ever had, not to mention the staff was very friendly and helpful by recommending rolls based on our preference. I highly recommend the western special, wet dream, and the blue fin special.  Not one of the rolls that we ordered was bad. This place is a must try!

I never did think that I'd be able to replace my favorite sushi restaurant (Sin City Sushi), but, it has happened. Well, sorta. 

I cannot completely write off Sin City, because once you have Young's garlic sauce, or his mussels, you will seriously crave them for days after... but, Blue Fin executes all their dishes delightfully well.

Jin, the owner (I believe) is from Hawaii. The first night I went with my boyfriend, it was a quiet Sunday night. We were served by a young woman who was also from Hawaii. Service was fast, friendly, and extremely patient!  Blue Fin has an exceptional selection of rolls, appetizers and nigiri.

My boyfriend and I usually get a lot of nigiri, and that night was no different. We had garlic tuna, hamachi, ika (with salt and lemon), amaebi, cajun albacore, tako, and a bunch more.

Great fish to rice ratio, and the few rolls that we did try were a good size (*PLUS, they do half rolls!*) 

They have awesome appetizers. I love mussels, but the mussels here are a little different from everywhere else. So just be aware that when ordering mussels here, they are already off the shell, and come in a special dish. We also had their tuna crab cake, salmon skin salad, and "poki" ( i always spelled it poke.. hmm)

All came with shredded beet and carrot toppings. I don't like beets AT ALL, regardless of what Dr. Oz says about the nutritional value they possess, it detracted from what would have been all together delicious, again, my own personal opinion.

Anyway, the restaurant setting and my overall experience here leads me to conclude that this restaurant is a solid 4 stars. Their quality of fish is on the higher end as compared with some other popular names in the AYCE sushi world.

Will go back if I'm in the area.

This is my families favorite place for Sushi, fresh and taste is great! Clean and great service. Friendly and attentive staff.  All you can eat.  We start with baked mussels and the PokiTuna salad. There rolls are all delicious. Atmosphere is relaxing.  We go at least twice a month. Dragon roll is our favorite.

I love coming here . The food and service is always great . Even if it's jam packed the service is prompt. Rolls are delicious and I love the lasagna rolls ! Most I've had to wait to be seated was about 15 minutes and that's when it was busy. The staff is very nice and courteous. I always tip them well because of it . It's family friendly ! Took the toddlers here the other day and it was a success, the staff even acknowledged the children very well and respectfully . Will keep coming here !

After calling the other popular ayce sushi place and finding out that it was a 2 hour wait on a Friday night,  we decided to come here instead.  The wait was only 20 min.   Although the price was a $1 more and the selection was a bit limited,  it was perfectly fine for us.   We were hungry and my in laws would never wait that long just to eat.   The service is fast and they don't take forever to bring out the food.  Rice to sushi ratio was fair and everything we tried was quite decent.   We would come back here again after enjoying our dinner without the long ridiculous wait time.   Hopefully this place doesn't get crazy busy likr the other places that serves ayce!

Pretty good AYCE sushi. The place is very small however and we went on a cold night so sitting outside was not an option. I don't eat raw fish much but the cooked rolls were delish! I would go back again!

This place deserves all stars. I've been eating AYCE sushi here for a few years now for all sorts of occasions and it never fails! Courteous service, fresh ingredients.100% painless. Our go to sushi spot!
Delicious place got to try it ! Sushi is bomb Katsura chicken pretty good my favorite is the mochi !! And if u don't know what that is u better come and try it

This is my first favorite sushi place since we moved to Vegas. One of my favorite rolls us a blue fin special roll. It has the right amount of spice to it and does not overwhelm your taste buds. 


So far this is my place to go for sushi.

4 star sushi 
3 star customer service 
1 star restaurant policy 

If u do AYCE 

Whatever you fail to finish eating the charge you for on top of the 25.00 ...... 

That's ridiculous . Period
the VOLCANO roll is my new favorite roll - great service, excellent food, extensive menu,

Great sushi! Good place to go for A.Y.C.E., Fresh fish and great appetizers. Only reason I didn't gice 5 starts is because the service was a little on the slow side. They seemed to be under staffed that night but we're handling it very well!

More like a 3.5 star review.

Finally, we tried the AYCE at Blue Fin, after all the talks about how amazing this AYCE is.  The uni nigiri was fresh, which is a good sign.  Afterward, we ordered orders of hamachi, amaebi, saba, salmon, and many more.  We decided that mackerel was our favorite so there came 4 more orders of them.  The amaebi wasn't as big and sweet/fresh as we have wanted to, but was decent.  

For dessert, I ordered all flavors available for the mochi, and tried out the red bean icecream.  I do like the fact that you can order how ever many dessert you want.  Service was really good.  Will I be coming back to Blue Fin?  It was decent, but I will go to Goyemon.

Came here last Friday with my boyfriend. We got seated immediately, our sever was very attentive, and there was a great selection of sushi on the menu. The sever was able to give suggestions to our preference and our rolls came out very quickly. I'm a huge sushi fan so I definitely will be adding this spot to my regular places. Highly recommend!

Came here for the all you can eat sushi and it was pretty good. I didn't enjoy the service at all! The waitress was irritated taking our order and irritated that we sat and talked after we were done with our meal. I would understand if the place was busy but it was completely empty! 

Service is everything for me and this place clearly misses the mark.

My other sushi spot was  crowded and I was hungry so I decided to drive to Blue Fin. Not very crowded on a Friday night so we took a seat at the sushi bar. The staff was on point, we never had to wait when ordering a roll. They even accommodated us to where my wife didn't like some of the items in a roll and they made it how we wanted it. Each roll I had was flavorful and fresh. I tried mochi for the first time, coffee flavored and found it to be an excellent end to the meal.

Lowering my rating to 1 star solely because of the service we got from Jin's IGNORANT wife.

My wife and I were the ONLY ONES there for lunch

We did AYCE as usual, did some nigiri, tried specials, tried different rolls, and we enjoyed the Chirashi(off the menu) so much, from attending Lisa L's UYE, we asked if we could order it...Jin wasn't there, but the other chef, Ynot was. we showed him the picture told him about the Yelp event,etc. so he checked with Jin's wife if it was possible.

This is what she said:

"Oh, this takes longer to prepare and this is for VIP people only."
I couldn't help but mumble to my wife, "F--K ME, I guess we're not considered VIP".

We were willing to pay
we were willing to wait
WE WERE THE ONLY ONES THERE

Chef Ynot sensed that we were pissed and disgusted, our orders stopped, and we just couldn't believe she had the nerve to say what she said...SERVICE IS PART OF THE DINING EXPERIENCE!

immediately chef Ynot made a roll on the fly and named it the Sylvia 
Roll. Thanks, but too little too late. As a business owner, every customer should be treated as a "VIP"

We finished the roll, thanked Chef Ynot and walked right out the door.
Thats the last time we'll ever go there....Thank goodness for Wayne's, Sushi Mon, and Sin City, Places where we're ALWAYS treated like VIPS....ALOHA!!!
The sushi staff is well trained and the fish is great...especially for the price.  The tako and uni with quail egg are my favorites.  Well done chefs!

WOW just super incredible!

Went late and they were open, not many people in here but then again it was around 9:30pm

Seated at the bar because that is the best place after all...

Greeted Politely by the chefs Kyle and Kevin, Explained our first time here and then my son and I were asked what we liked and did not like....The chefs went to work and let me tell you every single thing the chefs gave us were just incredible!

I found my newest Sushi hangout...You will not be disappointed in Blue Fin Fresh ingredients ... Does NOT smell of Fish...First sign of a good Sushi house.

The Salmon Skin Hand Roll was the BOMB...

When They say AYCE they mean it!..My son had one of every desert lol

Thanks again Kevin and Kyle My son and I will be back often

My all time favorite place! My only go to! Their sushi is actually fresh and well prepared and it's in whole places unlike other places who dice it up to hide the less fresh pieces. And their rice to fish ratio is always perfect. Super clean and awesome service. The only place I ever go now for sushi.

Today was my second time going to this sushi restaurant and it was just as good as the last time. I contemplated doing the AYCE ($27.00 for dinner) but decided that I wasn't hungry enough to eat AYCE. I was so glad that I opted out of ding AYCE because they serve huge rolls. Each roll I got was bigger than any I have ever gotten anywhere else. By the time I was done with my second roll I was stuffed! My only complaint is that their cream cheese tasted a bit odd none the less the sushi was overall really good.
Amazing! Royal shrimp is so yummy my new favorite sushi place they have large combos will definitely come back here with more people great environment and excellent staff

This is so sad for me to do.  I have been coming to blue fin since 2010.  It is the first place my son ate sushi.  It has a place in my heart.  The quality is still quite good but the service has gone from bad to terrible.  It takes forever to even see your wait staff.  Orders take forever if they are even put in.  40 minutes 5 items ordered and only 2 received.  On top of that we had to order the items twice.  This is depressing.

4.5 stars. The Johnny Johnny roll stands out--mild spicy soft shell crab inside, tuna, avocado and special sauce outside. They will serve half rolls during all you can eat. The rice is exceptional--a little more sweet than I am used to, but exceptional. Stellar cuts of fish for the nigiri! My husband's favorite was probably the Cajun Lover. 

I will definitely return.

Ive eaten here a couple times with the bf for lunch and its pretty good sushi. We get the two roll lunch special you get miso soup and a house salad and two rolls. I got the crunch roll and the California roll both were very good the portions are perfect just enough to fill you up but not over stuff you. The food is good quality and the service is excellent I cant wait to come here for dinner they have several specialty rolls that I wanna try. Oh and the prices are very reasonable the lunch special is only $8.95. If you haven't tried this place please do you wont be disappointed.

Love Blue Fin!  The fish is grubbin' and the staff is very nice and accommodating.  I usually like to stop in after class for the dinner time eats and have come a few times during lunch to chow down.  Although I'm usually a fan of baked mussels, I'm not a fan of the one they serve here.  Like Chris V. said, it's more a lasagna/pizza approach when I'm used to the sparingly sauced types of baked mussels out in the valley.  Other than that, Blue Fin does stellar and continually warrants repeated visits from time to time.  Try out the Mexican roll and the Hawaiian roll.. both of my favs.  Enjoy!

My favorite place for Sushi. The staff is always wonderful. The food is great. It's hard to pick a favorite roll, they are all tasty. There us something for everyone here! The lunch specials are very reasonable, as is their All-You-Can-Eat specials. Fast and friendly service, great food... it's our family's favorite!
So gross. I never had anything more disgusting, baked muscles just drenched in cheese, soggy sushi , nigiri super thin and chewy. Very bad. Service is not that great.

AYCE here is definitely a bang for your buck here! Every time I stop by to eat here, I always get AYCE. Their staff is amazing. They're all so very nice and attentive. A local, small business and gets their fish shipped in daily to ensure you get the freshest of the fresh fish we could get (say that three times).

My fave:

YELLOWTAIL COLLAR: Super fatty full of flavor, slightly sweet with a smokey taste. All yellow tail and barely any collar bone.

SPICY POKE SALAD: sssooo good, refreshing, and light with slight kick to it. If you are looking for a light meal for lunch or dinner to pick at ala carte. This would be a fine choice (that is if you're choosing between the seaweed salad and the poke salad)

SUSHI FAVES: Rainbow Roll, Caterpillar, Volcano, Fire Cracker, and Over the Rainbow.

Kyle was such an amazing company the first time I came, and our waitresses (both times I came) were marvelous. The first time, Kyle took us to a different sushi journey and whipped up a concoction of his own. I wish I could remember what he named it, but you can request for his signature dish. Kyle also gave us some of his famous "secret lychee ice cream" which unfortunately no longer a secret (sorry Kyle!). I asked for some the second time and it was nice of the waitress to check. Unfortunately, they were out of it (figures...).

Always one of my faves.

The last few times I've been in Vegas, I time my workouts in the morning so I can have the lunch AYCE at Blue Fin. Unlike Sumo, you can order the sashimi appetizers like the ahi poke salad at lunch. Such a great deal and super tasty. All of the specialty rolls I have tried are packed full of fresh fish and not giant rice balls designed to fill you up. And any nigiri you order seems to come to you immediately.

Garlic tuna nigiri is especially tasty, and their spicy hand rolls are fantastic. Can't wait to go back in June!
Went here with a friend on a Saturday afternoon and had the all you can eat lunch. Other then a few dinner items, nothing was off limits. It was good. I will be back if I am in that area.

This place is crazy busy, even with reservation we had to wait. 

Of course ordered all you can eat, its the only way to eat sushi. It was pretty good just slow coming food and the sushi all came before our appetizers.

No, seriously our miso soup arrived last. We also needed a fork for a child and we asked 4 servers before one of them finally came back with it.

Flavors are good and as many servers stop by the table there seems to be some miscommunication between them and our order.
Could have been better. Sushi was as good as anywhere. Staff not welcoming or friendly. I got the vibe we were a pain not a pleasure.

Their service was very good! I went in at 3 pm on a Wednesday so it wasn't packed and our food was served to us really quickly.   Overall food was delicious and service was great! If you love sushi their AYCE is the way to go! Would recommend this place I'm definitely going back!
Giving this place 5 stars cause I'm happy every time I'm here, and in comparison to other sushi places in the area, it's better.

Good ayce place!! Sushi came out a little bit slow and the server forgot our order a couple of time that's why the review is lower, but the rolls are very good! The beer tasted good too  but a go if you are feeling up to an ayce sushi place

Love this place!!!! Wet dream roll is one of personal favorites but they have so many more good ones to try. We always leave happy and stuffed. Seating is comfortable.This place is a must try. We will be back.

One of my older go to sushi places.. 
used to be obsessed but over time my favorite place degraded and I had to upgrade to sushi Kaya or Kaizen. Overall if you're in a bit of a hurry and are looking to eat a quick AYCE . This is the place to go

I've had a lot of sushi, and this was just an okay joint. Their screaming o leaves a lot to be desired...needless to say not much screaming went on. 

Their hand rolls were great, and decently priced. I got a salmon hand roll and a natto hand roll. There was no wait, and service was almost....too good. For example, I pick up the natto hand roll off the plate I'm eating and take a bite, and as I'm taking a bite one of the busboys (of which there were three hovering over the dining area like buzzards over a body) swoops in a grabs the plate. I'm clearly eating off of it, but don't even have time to object as I just took a huge bite.

I will try this place again, as it wasn't overpriced at all. We got two hand rolls, the blue fin special roll, and a screaming orgasm, and the bill came to about 34 bucks. Was enough to fill up the two of us.
Sushi is okay. Service is okay. Nothing special. Salads are good, especially the dressing. Prices are reasonable.

One of the worst sushi places I have tried. I walked in and I was the only person there. I should have walked out after the smell of sewer hit my nose, but I did not want to be rude. The shrimp was flat...FLAT and there was lemon juice drizzled on it, probably to hide the lack of freshness. The staff was very good. The service was not bad. I am not sure why so many local sushi places feel the need to blare hip-hop. Sushi is supposed to be relaxing and social. I cannot see myself returning

Bluefin is one my top ten sushi spots in Las Vegas. 

Although their AYCE menu isn't as good as other places in Chinatown, they are conveniently located near my school in Henderson so I can't complain. I love how their sushi is really fresh and thick. Although the rice to sushi ratio isn't the best (because let's be real, we all prefer more fish and less rice) the quality of fish is worth it.

Plus, they have an affordable lunch special menu that include a miso soup and chef salad with all the dishes. I always order the Sashimi Special Combo for 15.95. It is a 10 piece sashimi dish that includes: tuna, yellowtail, salmon, shrimp, white fish, miso soup, and house salad.

We didn't have a lot of time to eat before a movie we were going to see so we stopped here for some quick sushi. We shared AYCE, the sushi was some of the best I've had in Las Vegas and the service was excellent. The server was attentive and the chefs were fast. My new favorite sushi restaurant.

I've been all over the world eating sushi. The service was average. The food was priced well. Didn't expect an all you can eat to be good but it was. We had a varied amour of nigiri and sushi. I ordered miso soup and it never came. There was empty tables all around at lunch on a Friday. We we sat by the door at the window and would expect to be in the heart of the restaurant. If your new to sushi or not a picky sushi eater this would be good especially if you eat a lot and do all you can eat. If your very picky on service then probably best to skip. The fish was fresh and the story I was told about the owner having several of these restaurants is probably the reason. I've found really good authentic Japanese restaurants have a few things. A Japanese name, packed seating, Japanese eating there. It's also good if the chef is native Japanese as there is honor in their culture with fresh fish which is not always inexpensive. So I say go if your a family and want good food on a good budget and not picky on service.
